0.title: A competitor's trying to go after us: FTX CEO on 'false' insolvency rumours
0.article_body: FTX's billionaire Founder and CEO Sam Bankman-Fried said, "FTX is fine. Assets are fine," amid insolvency rumours after its competitor Binance announced plans to liquidate its entire holdings of FTX's native tokens. "A competitor is trying to go after us with false rumours," he tweeted, adding that FTX keeps "audited financials" and is "highly regulated".

1.title: 5 wagons of goods train derail in Jhansi; rail traffic affected
1.article_body: Five wagons of a goods train derailed in Jhansi's Virangana Lakshmibai railway station yard on Tuesday, rail officials said. The derailment, which took place around 5.30 am, has affected both up and down traffic on Jhansi-Mustra and Jhansi-Karari sections, the PRO said. The PRO added that efforts are on to restore services and that some trains were diverted.

2.title: President Murmu and PM Modi wish everyone on Guru Nanak Jayanti
2.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished everyone a happy Guru Nanak Jayanti. President Murmu urged people to adopt the teachings of Japji Sahib, like truth, sacrifice and moral conduct. PM Modi took to Twitter and said, "May his noble teachings continue to guide us in our endeavour of building a...compassionate society."

3.title: China playing aggressive games with Canada democracy: Trudeau
3.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said that China is playing "aggressive games" with democracies and Canadian institutions. This comes after a local media report claimed that China had funded a "clandestine network" of candidates in Canada's 2019 election. The report also alleged that Beijing sought to place agents in the offices of members of the Parliament in order to influence policy.

4.title: Special players don't stay down for long: Hayden on Babar, Rizwan
4.article_body: Speaking ahead of their semi-final against New Zealand in the T20 World Cup, Pakistan mentor Matthew Hayden backed their openers Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan to regain form, stating that special players don't stay down for long. "Babar and Rizwan rightly are [the] number one combination," he added. Babar has scored 39 runs in five innings in the ongoing tournament.

5.title: Ashwin reacts to viral video of him smelling jackets during toss against Zimbabwe
5.article_body: India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has reacted after he was caught on camera smelling warm-up jackets during toss against Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup 2022. On being asked by Abhinav Mukund about his logic of picking the right "sweater", Ashwin tweeted, "Checked for...sizes to differentiate! (didn't work) Checked if it was initialed (didn't work) Finally checked for...the perfume i use (worked)."

6.title: 'Are you going to pay $8, Elon?' asks Twitter user on blue tick fee, Musk says '100%'
6.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday shared a photo of a T-shirt with a text that read, "Your feedback is appreciated. Now pay $8", a response he had given to US lawmaker Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez regarding the $8 blue tick subscription service. Commenting on it, a Twitter user wrote, "Are you going to pay the $8, Elon?" to which he replied 100%.

7.title: UPI frauds led to 15.3% rise in cybercrime complaints between Q1, Q2 in 2022: MHA
7.article_body: The unified payments interface (UPI) frauds contributed to a 15.3% increase in the overall number of complaints reported on the National Cybercrime Reporting Portal between the first and second quarters of 2022, the Ministry of Home Affairs data showed. The overall number of registered complaints in Q1 of 2022 was 2,06,198, while it grew to 2,37,658 in the second quarter.

8.title: Dead cobra found in Ghaziabad society's water tank, police complaint filed
8.article_body: A dead cobra was found inside the water tank of a society in Ghaziabad. Reports said that the residents of the society had been complaining of skin rashes and stomach infections. A police complaint was lodged against the developer of the society. The residents claimed the snake was found in the tank that stored drinking water.

9.title: Man cuts childhood friend's private parts, stuffs them in his mouth in Maharashtra
9.article_body: A 21-year-old hotel owner was murdered by his childhood friend who stabbed him nine times, cut his private parts and stuffed them in his mouth in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi. Aslam Ansari used to like Shamim Ansari's girlfriend and when Shamim refused to leave her he murdered him. The incident happened when they were having a party in the hotel of deceased.

10.title: BBMP invites applications to hire 63 doctors at Namma Clinics in B'luru
10.article_body: After completing the process of appointing 180 doctors last month, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) invited applications to hire 63 more doctors. The clinics are scheduled to open on December 15, officials said. Out of 438 Namma Clinics across Karnataka, 243 will be operational in Bengaluru. We hope to complete the hiring process this month, a BBMP official said.

11.title: 1,800 Bihar healthcare centres issued closure warning over waste disposal
11.article_body: The Bihar State Pollution Control Board (BSPCB) said it has issued closure warning notices to 1,800 healthcare centres in six districts across the state for not complying with the norms of bio-medical waste disposal. If these centres fail to adhere to the norms of treatment of medical waste within 15 days, their closure will be ordered, BSPCB added.

12.title: Delhi HC awards Louis Vuitton ₹20 lakh in trademark violation case against Club Factory
12.article_body: The Delhi High Court has awarded ₹20 lakh to Louis Vuitton in its trademark infringement suit against Club Factory, a Chinese e-shopping platform that was banned in India. In the suit filed in 2020, Louis Vuitton alleged that the Club Factory website indulged in the unauthorised sale of its products that carried the marks of Louis Vuitton.

13.title: Situation is tough, no one is going to theatres: Amitabh Bachchan
13.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan has requested fans to buy tickets and watch films at theatres. He said, "Aajkal badi maramari chal ri hai, koi ja hi nahi raha hai theatre mein (The situation is very tough these days. No one is going to the theatre)." Adding to him, Neena Gupta informed that the tickets for their upcoming film 'Uunchai' will cost ₹150.

14.title: Suryakumar's record against slow left-arm spin doesn't stand out: Hussain
14.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain termed Suryakumar Yadav as a "freakish talent", but added that his record against slow left-arm spin "doesn't really stand out". "It is hard to find any weakness," stated Hussain. Ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis had earlier termed "bombarding" Suryakumar with short deliveries as the best as well as the "only way" to dismiss him in T20s.

15.title: Several actors have wrong intentions from the beginning of a film: Boney
15.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor said there are several actors who have "wrong" intentions from the beginning of a film. "[Their] first thought process is dishonest...The film won't be successful in case of an absence of honesty," added Boney. "Several actors charge fully for 25-30 days of work...There are quite a few actors who want everything to be convenient," he stated.

16.title: Man sexually exploits woman on pretext of marriage in Pune
16.article_body: A case has been filed after a man allegedly sexually exploited a 31-year-old woman on the pretext of marriage in Pune. The woman said in her complaint that when she asked about the marriage later, the accused refused and physically assaulted her, according to police officials. The accused and the woman are both members of a library, police said.

17.title: Punjab man gets trapped in fire caused by stubble burning; rescued
17.article_body: A 29-year-old man suffered burn injuries after he got trapped in a fire caused by stubble burning in Punjab's Ferozepur on Monday. Passers-by had rescued the man, however, his two-wheeler was reportedly reduced to ashes in the incident. The man, who is a barber, claimed that he had fallen unconscious after getting trapped in the fire.

18.title: Versova-Andheri metro ridership rises after Gokhale bridge closure
18.article_body: Ridership of stations in Mumbai's Andheri, namely Versova, DN Nagar and Azad Nagar increased by over 17% after the closure of Gokhale bridge, which connected the east and west sides of Andheri. The overall ridership on Versova-Andheri-Ghatkopar blue line increased by around 11,000 passengers yesterday (till 5 pm), compared to last Monday, according to Mumbai Metro One Private Limited's data.

19.title: Deloitte India fires employee who ran global hacking gang that targeted ex-Pak PM
19.article_body: Deloitte India has fired Aditya Jain, a 31-year-old employee who ran a global hacking group named 'WhiteInt' out of a Gurugram apartment. He ran a network of hackers who were hired to steal email inboxes of their targets. Jain's firm reportedly targeted former Pakistan PM Pervez Musharraf, BMW co-owner Stefan Quandt and members of UK's wealthiest families, including Ashok Hinduja.

20.title: Bus meets with an accident in J&K's Handwara; 20 people injured
20.article_body: At least 20 people were injured after a bus they were travelling in met with an accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Handwara on Tuesday. Officials said that the bus had turned turtle while on its way to Srinagar, Kashmir News Observer reported. Earlier, six people were injured in a car accident on the snow-covered Gulmarg-Butapathri road, a press release said.

21.title: Cong's Krishna Kumar Pandey dies while participating in Bharat Jodo Yatra
21.article_body: Congress leader Krishna Kumar Pandey died on Tuesday while participating in Bharat Jodo Yatra which entered Maharashtra. "Pandey, General Secretary of Seva Dal, was holding the national flag and walking with Digvijaya Singh and me...He handed the flag to a colleague...Thereafter he collapsed," Congress' Jairam Ramesh tweeted. Pandey was taken to hospital where he was declared dead, Ramesh stated.

22.title: Shocking that no one apologised: Chidambaram on Morbi bridge collapse
22.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said it is shocking that no one has apologised or resigned for the Morbi bridge collapse tragedy in Gujarat. He added, "Gujarat is governed from Delhi and not by the Chief Minister." "ED and CBI are working at BJP's behest, 95% of those arrested by such agencies are Opposition politicians," Chidambaram stated.

23.title: 21-yr-old threatens & harasses former schoolmate, arrested in Chennai
23.article_body: The Chennai Police on Monday arrested a 21-year-old, identified as V Gautham, for allegedly harassing a 19-year-old woman and threatening to upload her pictures on the internet if she didn't continue her relations with him. The victim and accused were schoolmates. He approached her on November 4 and when she refused to talk to him, he created a ruckus.

24.title: N Korea denies US claims of sending weapons to Russia amid Ukraine war
24.article_body: North Korea has denied US claims that it is shipping artillery shells and ammunition to Russia to be used in the war against Ukraine. This comes after North Korea conducted a series of weapons tests which included short-range and intercontinental missiles. Pyongyang said it was testing weapons to "mercilessly" strike key US and South Korean targets if it chooses to.

25.title: 2 Nigerian TikTok stars to be whipped 20 times for mocking govt official
25.article_body: A judge in Nigeria has ordered two TikTok stars to be given 20 lashes each, pay a $22 fine and clean the court for 30 days after they used the social media app to mock a government official. Mubarak Isa Muhammed and Muhammed Bula allegedly defamed Kano State's Governor, Abdullahi Ganduje, by saying he's corrupt, sells people's land and oversleeps.

26.title: Still processing Chadwick Boseman's loss: 'Black Panther...' actress Lupita
26.article_body: 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' actress Lupita Nyong'o said the team is still processing the loss of Chadwick Boseman. "Chadwick left a very big hole," she said, adding that the sequel "honours" the actor's legacy. She added that she's "glad" the makers "didn't replace" Chadwick and is hopeful that the film will encourage people who've lost hope to move forward.

27.title: Anti-dumping duty on Chinese metal cutter wheels not to be imposed
27.article_body: As the Finance Ministry has not accepted the recommendations of the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) for imposing anti-dumping duty on Chinese metal cutter wheels, the government has decided not to impose the levy. DGTR, under the Commerce Ministry, conducted a probe into the alleged dumping of "Resin Bonded Thin Wheels" from China and recommended imposition of the duty.

28.title: Not dying anytime soon: Samantha after media calls Myositis diagnosis 'life-threatening'
28.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who recently revealed that she has been diagnosed with autoimmune condition Myositis, has clarified that her Myositis is not at a stage that is life-threatening. "I saw a lot of articles describing my condition as life-threatening. But the stage I am in, it's not life-threatening for me. I am not dying anytime soon," she said.

29.title: Man's 'UFO' pic to friend amid smog in Delhi goes viral
29.article_body: A picture sent by a man to his friend amid the smog in Delhi has gone viral on social media. The man's friend shared the picture of a "flying saucer" in Delhi which turned out to be a water tower. Reacting to the picture, that looked similar to a "UFO", a user wrote, "That really is very depressing."

30.title: UP court defers verdict on plea for Shivling worship at Gyanvapi mosque
30.article_body: A fast-track court in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, on Tuesday didn't pronounce a verdict on the maintainability of the plea seeking the worship of Shivling that the Hindu side claimed was found on the premises of the Gyanvapi mosque. The matter will be heard on November 14. The plea also demands handing over complex to Hindus and banning entry of Muslims.

31.title: Can't fire that many people & expect site to be healthy: Early Twitter investor on layoffs
31.article_body: One of Twitter's early investors, Chris Sacca, has shared a thread about Elon Musk's takeover of the social media company. Talking about the recent layoffs at the company, Sacca wrote, "So much product and policy talent was pushed out the company door...you just can't fire that many engineers, ops, and SREs and expect the site to stay healthy."

32.title: What did SC say on acquitting 3 men sentenced to death for rape-murder of 19-yr-old girl?
32.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday acquitted three men sentenced to death by a trial court for the gangrape and murder of a 19-year-old girl in Delhi in 2012. The court said the prosecution, whose case rested on circumstantial evidence, had failed to prove it. "The court has noticed many glaring lapses having occurred during the course of the trial," it added.

33.title: Was diagnosed with spondylitis during 'Jhalak...': Paras Kalnawat
33.article_body: Actor Paras Kalnawat revealed that he was diagnosed with spondylitis during 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'. He said that he also had muscle tear in his knees but he didn't want to quit the show as it "was more important" to him than his health. "I've been popping medicines and muscle relaxants to not feel the pain while rehearsing," he added.

34.title: Haryana woman sarpanch arrested for booth capturing in panchayat polls
34.article_body: A newly-elected woman sarpanch was arrested for her alleged involvement in capturing a booth in the November 2 panchayat elections in Haryana's Nuh, police said. "After filing an FIR, we investigated and found the involvement of the newly-elected sarpanch Rashida and arrested her. We are also verifying the role of others and they will be arrested soon," police added.

35.title: Smoke weed but understand importance of water conservation: BJP MP
35.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MP Janardan Mishra said that he does not have a problem if people chew tobacco, drink alcohol, smoke weed, inhale thinner or spend money on religious works. "But do understand the importance of water conservation," he said at a workshop. He added that water must be saved and that lands are running dry.

36.title: 3 police jurisdictions in Pune to get new deputy commissioners of police
36.article_body: The three police jurisdictions in the Pune district, Pune City, Pimpri Chinchwad and Pune rural, will get new deputy commissioners of police (DCPs). The new Pune city DCPs will be Sandeep Singh Gill, Shashikant Borate, Smartana Patil, Vijaykumar Magar, Vikrant Deshmukh, Suhail Sharma and Amol Zende. This comes after the Maharashtra Home Department ordered the reshuffle of 104 police officers.

37.title: No player has the guts to even attempt Suryakumar's scoop shot: Kaif
37.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said he doesn't think "any player has the guts to even attempt" the scoop shot played by Suryakumar Yadav. "Every player...[is fearful] that the ball will splice off the bat and hit the grill," added Kaif. "However, Suryakumar's different, forget the fear of getting hit, he's scoring [the] bulk of his runs with that...shot," he stated.

38.title: Chris Evans named 2022's Sexiest Man Alive by People magazine
38.article_body: Hollywood actor Chris Evans has been named as People magazine's 'Sexiest Man Alive' for 2022. The 41-year-old 'Captain America' actor said that the title "feels like a weird form of humble bragging" and added, "My mom will be so happy." Actor Paul Rudd was named the Sexiest Man Alive by the magazine last year.

39.title: PM Modi visits Advani's residence on his birthday, Shah extends greetings
39.article_body: On the occasion of BJP leader Lal Krishna Advani's 95th birthday, PM Modi visited his residence this morning and extended his greetings. Union Home Minister Amit Shah also wished the leader and said, "Advani ji, with his relentless efforts, strengthened the party...across the country and also made [an] invaluable contribution to the country's development while being part of the government."

40.title: BJP's double-engine govt will derail soon: Sachin Pilot in Himachal
40.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday said that the double-engine government of BJP will derail soon. While addressing a press conference in Himachal Pradesh, Pilot said, "One engine of the government of double engine will seize to function on November 12 and the other in 2024." "There is infighting in BJP in the state," he stated.

41.title: Elon Musk shares rules for using Twitter, says 'They will evolve over time'
41.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Monday shared rules that users must follow while using the microblogging site and wrote, "Twitter rules will evolve over time." While the rules largely appeared to be the same as before, a new section on 'Misleading and Deceptive Identities' has been added. It forbids users against impersonating others to mislead, confuse or deceive people.

42.title: Women would take sand & put it in their maang: Janhvi on Rajesh Khanna
42.article_body: Discussing the star culture in Bollywood, actress Janhvi Kapoor said, "My father Boney Kapoor...[would tell] stories about how Rajesh Khanna's car would drive away and women would take the sand and put it in their maang." "[They wouldn't]...do that for anyone today," added Janhvi. Talking about Rajesh Khanna, actor Vijay Deverakonda had stated, "Me and the generation after...don't care."

43.title: NVIDIA to sell new advanced chip to China that meets US export rules
43.article_body: NVIDIA Corporation is offering a new advanced chip, called the A800, to China that meets US' export control rules. This is the first by a US semiconductor company to create advanced processors for China according to the new rules. US in October announced export controls limiting sale of semiconductor technology to China to cripple Beijing's ability to access critical technologies.

44.title: 8 arrested for performing car stunts that killed ragpicker in Gurugram
44.article_body: Eight people were arrested in connection with the death of a 50-year-old ragpicker, who was knocked down by a person performing car stunts allegedly under the influence of alcohol in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar, the police said. CCTV cameras showed around 10-12 youths performing stunts using three cars in front of a liquor outlet on Sunday, the police said.

45.title: 19-yr-old attacked with iron rods & sickles by 20 youths in Pune, dies
45.article_body: A 19-year-old college student died after he was allegedly attacked with iron rods and sickles by nearly 20-22 youngsters in the Talegaon Dabhade area of Pune on Sunday. Police have apprehended nine accused, including four minors. The incident happened after the deceased's friend and one of the accused got into an argument. The deceased fell down while running, said police.

46.title: PM Modi visiting Karnataka as election is fast approaching: Siddaramaiah
46.article_body: Ahead of PM Modi's visit to Bengaluru on November 11, Congress leader Siddaramaiah said that PM is coming to Karnataka because Assembly election is fast approaching. He also questioned his contributions to the state. "What has [PM] done [for Karnataka]? When there were floods, he did not come, did not hear out the woes of the people," said Siddaramaiah.

47.title: Conor McGregor shares pics of his physical transformation
47.article_body: Ex-UFC featherweight and lightweight champion Conor McGregor took to Instagram to share pictures of his physical transformation. The pictures show McGregor at over 65 kg in 2015, at over 70 kg in 2021 and at a predicted 77 kg in 2022. "You're at least 190 pounds (86 kg) right now," a fan wrote. "When will you fight?" asked another fan.

48.title: Britney Spears reveals she has incurable nerve damage, says 'it feels like needles'
48.article_body: Britney Spears has revealed she's suffering from incurable nerve damage. "Nerves are tiny and it feels like pins and needles from the right side of my body, it shoots up to my neck," she wrote. She said she doesn't feel the pain while dancing, adding, "I finally found a medication where I actually feel oxygen going to my brain."

49.title: Teacher undergoes gender change surgery to become male, marries student in Rajasthan
49.article_body: A physical education teacher in Rajasthan's Bharatpur has undergone a gender change surgery to become a male and married his student. "I always wished to undergo surgery to change my gender. I had my first surgery in December 2019," said Aarav Kuntal. "I loved him...Even if he had not done this surgery, I would have married him," said Kalpana.

50.title: Musk is alone right now & is winging this: Twitter's early investor Chris Sacca
50.article_body: Venture capitalist Chris Sacca, one of the first investors in Twitter, shared a thread about Elon Musk’s takeover of Twitter. Sacca wrote, "I've known Elon a long time. I've admired his thinking & ambition….His success to date is not an accident….He has plenty of "pals"...But the hard truth is that he is straight-up alone right now and winging this."

51.title: Iranians knock off, steal clerics' turbans in protest against veil
51.article_body: Amid the anti-veil protests in Iran, protestors have now started knocking off and stealing the turbans worn by religious clerics. The protests began after the death of Mahsa Amini. The 22-year-old died on September 16 after being allegedly assaulted by the country's morality police for not wearing the hijab properly.

52.title: Being a new mom is insane, my son is the happiest boy: Rihanna
52.article_body: Singer Rihanna said that her baby boy is "the happiest baby" and added that whenever he smiles "everything else just goes away". Rihanna gave birth to her baby boy in May this year. She further added that being a new mother has been "insane" and "epic". On the work front, Rihanna sang Black Panther: Wakanda Forever's song 'Lift Me Up'.

53.title: UP CM orders CBI probe into AYUSH admission scam, 2 officials suspended
53.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday ordered a CBI investigation into the alleged scam of "fraudulent admissions" to Ayurveda and Unani colleges under the AYUSH Department through NEET-2021. The Acting Director (AYUSH) SN Singh, and the In-charge Official of Education Directorate (AYUSH) Umakant Yadav have been suspended. "Action against two other officials...underway," an official said.

54.title: All decisions made with Anushka's consent, it's not because she's bossy: Aditya
54.article_body: Actor Aditya Seal said that every decision that he makes is with the consent of actress-wife Anushka Ranjan. "That's not because she's bossy or she has to know everything that's happening. It's just that we're living a life together. Our decisions affect each other...We take every call together, irrespective of whether it pertains to her life or mine," he added.

55.title: Man sets ablaze wife, her son and live-in partner in Hyderabad
55.article_body: A man set ablaze wife, her son and live-in partner in Hyderabad's Chikkadpally by pouring petrol on them while they were near a flower shop. The accused Nagula Sai married S Aarthi eight years ago but due to some clashes between them, they started living separately. Later, Aarthi got acquainted with Nagaraju and they both had a son named Vishnu.

56.title: 'Twitter usage is at an all-time high lol,' tweets Elon Musk; shares graphs
56.article_body: Twitter's new owner and the world's richest person Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted that the social media platform's "usage is at an all-time high lol". In another tweet he wrote, "I just hope the servers don't melt!" Musk later shared graphs showing a surge in Twitter's monetisable daily active users (mDAUs) globally and in the US since July this year.

57.title: Service flat owners to be penalised for allowing parties without permits in Hyd
57.article_body: Cyberabad Police in Hyderabad warned service apartments' owners against renting out apartments without collecting ID proofs, phone numbers and allowing guests to occupy them temporarily. "Permission from GHMC...other departments concerned should be obtained before renting out premises for parties...Legal action to be initiated if management shows any negligence," DCP (Madhapur) K Shilpavali said.

58.title: NZ mosque shooter who killed 51 files appeal against life sentence
58.article_body: An Australian terrorist who killed 51 Muslim worshippers at two mosques in New Zealand's Christchurch in March 2019 has filed an appeal against his life sentence, a court spokesperson said. Brenton Tarrant was sentenced to life in prison without parole in 2020 after he pleaded guilty to 51 counts of murder, 40 counts of attempted murder and a terrorism charge.

59.title: Aurobindo Pharma recalls medicines in US due to manufacturing lapses
59.article_body: Aurobindo Pharma USA is recalling 9,504 bottles of medication used to treat high blood pressure from the US market, the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) said. The lot has been recalled due to "current good manufacturing practices CGMP deviations," USFDA added. The recalled Quinapril and Hydrochlorothiazide tablets were manufactured in India and marketed in US by Aurobindo Pharma USA.

60.title: Hopefully, we can shut him down: Stokes on Suryakumar ahead of T20 WC semis
60.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes has said that they'll have to shut India's Suryakumar Yadav down before he "gets on one of his rampages" in their 2022 T20 World Cup semi-final on Thursday. "Suryakumar plays some shots where you're scratching your head sometimes," added Stokes. "Thursday is all about which team turns up and can perform best," he further said.

61.title: Few areas near B'luru to face power cuts on Wednesday and Thursday
61.article_body: A few areas near Bengaluru will face power cuts on Wednesday and Thursday due to maintenance work being undertaken by KPTCL. The outage will last for six hours from 10 am-4 pm, data on BESCOM website suggested. The work will be initiated in Ramanagara circle and the areas likely to be affected are Harohalli, T K Halli and Somanahalli.

62.title: It's the worst draw: Barca manager Xavi on being drawn against Man Utd
62.article_body: Barcelona manager Xavi termed being drawn against Manchester United in the Europa League playoffs as the "worst draw" that his team could have got. "The draw has given us the most difficult rival again, like in the Champions League group stage...Once again. No luck," added Xavi. "It is a massive challenge for us...We will have to compete," he stated.

63.title: Never refused to negotiate with Russia, will talk to Putin's successor: Ukraine
63.article_body: Mykhailo Podolyak, a senior adviser to Ukrainian President has said that Kyiv never refused to negotiate with Moscow and will hold talks with future Russian leader but not Vladimir Putin as he is not ready. The comments come after The Washington Post reported that the Biden administration was privately encouraging Ukrainian leaders to signal openness to hold talks with Moscow.

64.title: World is on highway to climate hell: UN chief warns at COP27 summit
64.article_body: Addressing world leaders at the COP27 climate summit in Egypt on Monday, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned that the world is "on the highway to climate hell with our foot still on the accelerator". He added that "we are in the fight of our lives, and we are losing" as greenhouse gas emissions and global temperatures are still rising.

65.title: India reports lowest daily COVID-19 cases in 7 months with 625 new infections
65.article_body: India has reported 625 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, which is the lowest single-day rise in the number of cases in over seven months. This comes a day after the country reported 937 fresh COVID-19 cases. No deaths were reported in the last 24 hours due to coronavirus. The active cases in India stand at 14,021.

66.title: Messi is obsessed with scoring goals, Neymar has an animal inside: Alves
66.article_body: Ex-Barcelona footballer Dani Alves said Lionel Messi is "obsessed" with scoring goals, adding that all he thinks about is scoring goals. "Neymar has an animal inside, which...[comes out] when people...[try] to harm it...Then you're dead," added Alves. "When I played against...[them], I told my teammates, 'Don't beat them up, don't let the animal inside these guys wake up'," he stated.

67.title: Maharashtra to enter 'red zone' for aerosol pollution in 2023: Study
67.article_body: According to a study, Maharashtra may breathe more toxic air in 2023. The aerosol pollution levels are likely to enter the "red zone" category, which is considered highly vulnerable. It may lead to a drop in visibility levels and pose a host of health problems for people. The aerosol optical depth can be used as a proxy measurement of PM2.5.

68.title: Amid rising traffic chaos, PMC serves notice to Maha-Metro, PMRDA
68.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has served notices to Maha-Metro and Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) amid criticism over rising traffic chaos. A PMC official said that it was realised that barricading work for Metro and flyover work was one of the reasons for traffic chaos and at some places, it was done where "no work had started at all".

69.title: Mumbai auto driver breaks into sister's house, steals ₹26 lakh
69.article_body: A 35-year-old autorickshaw driver has been arrested for allegedly breaking into his sister's house and decamping with valuables worth ₹26.6 lakh in Maharashtra's Thane district, the police said. The accused had fled with his entire family after committing the crime, the police added. The police arrested the accused, who had fled to Vapi in neighbouring Gujarat, based on a tip-off.

70.title: French Cardinal admits to abusing teen 35 years ago, ends religious duties
70.article_body: France's Cardinal Jean-Pierre Ricard admitted on Monday that he had abused a 14-year-old girl 35 years ago, announcing withdrawal from his religious duties. "35 years ago, when I was a priest, I behaved in a reprehensible way towards a girl aged 14...no doubt that my behaviour caused serious and long-lasting consequences for that person," Ricard said.

71.title: Where do broken hearts go: Sania Mirza in post amid rumours of divorce with Shoaib Malik
71.article_body: Amid rumours that Sania Mirza and Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Malik are parting ways, the Indian tennis star shared a cryptic story on Instagram. "Where do broken hearts go? To find Allah," the post read. Sania and Shoaib tied the knot in 2010 and have a four-year-old son Izhaan. Earlier, Pakistani media reports suggested Shoaib cheated on Sania.

72.title: North Korea releases pics of its series of missile launches
72.article_body: North Korea's Korean Central News Agency has released pictures of the country's series of missile launches. North Korea fired 23 missiles on Wednesday last week, a record for a single day. North Korea on Monday said that the launches were simulated strikes on South Korea and US as the two countries held a "dangerous war drill".

73.title: With 'mashaal' in hand, Rahul Gandhi enters Maha for Bharat Jodo Yatra
73.article_body: Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra, led by party leader Rahul Gandhi, entered Maharashtra on Monday night. Gandhi along with other party leaders held 'mashaal' in their hands. Gandhi said during his stay in Maharashtra over the next 15 days, he will listen to the voice of the state and also its pain. He stated that no force can stop his yatra.

74.title: Sanfe raises $1.5 million in funding round from existing investors
74.article_body: Sanfe, a brand offering women's hygiene products, has raised $1.5 million in a funding round from existing investors such as S Chand Family Office, Seeders, LetsVenture and angel investors including Abhay Tandon and Yash Kotak. Last year, Sanfe raised $1 million in a Series A funding round. With the latest funding round, Sanfe has raised $2.5 million in all.

75.title: Fresh non-bailable warrant against Maha MP, father in fake caste case
75.article_body: A court issued a fresh non-bailable warrant (NBW) against Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her father in a fake caste certificate case. The two are accused of forging a caste certificate as the seat from where she is elected is reserved for SC candidates. An NBW was issued against them in September which is yet to be executed.

76.title: Woman attacks Emirates airline employee, vandalises Mexico airport after missing flight
76.article_body: A video has surfaced showing a woman attacking an Emirates airline check-in staff at Mexico City International Airport after arriving late and attempting to use an expired passport for which  she was refused to travel. Video showed that she climbed over the counter, entering check-in desks, throwing equipment on the floor and shouting. The woman was eventually removed by security.

77.title: Rohit Sharma suffers injury scare ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final
77.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma suffered an injury scare while batting in the nets ahead of T20 World Cup semi-final against England. Rohit was hit on his right forearm while attempting to hit a pull shot. He seemed to be in pain and discontinued the net session instantly. He was attended to by team physio and team doctor.

78.title: Fugitive arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari to be extradited to India, orders UK court
78.article_body: A UK court has ordered the extradition of fugitive arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari to India to face charges of tax evasion and money laundering. The 60-year-old is accused of concealing assets, using backdated documents, benefiting from the assets not declared to Indian tax authorities and then falsely informing authorities he didn't possess any overseas assets.

79.title: If you had 6 Suryakumars, I'd have all of them in my team: Tom Moody
79.article_body: Ex-Australian cricketer Tom Moody has said India should keep Suryakumar Yadav at the number four position as the 32-year-old seems "comfortable" and is in "red-hot form". Moody added, "If you had six Suryakumars, I'd have all six of them in my team...He can bat anywhere. No question about that." Suryakumar is currently the top-ranked T20I batter in the world.

80.title: All construction sites in Delhi-NCR must use anti-smog guns: CAQM
80.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has directed all construction and demolition sites in Delhi-NCR to deploy anti-smog guns. The commission said that deployment of an anti-smog gun is mandatory for construction sites of over 5,000 square metres (sqm). Moreover, it has directed pollution control boards in Delhi-NCR to ensure the continuous and effective use of these anti-smog guns.

81.title: Strong impression Putin will skip G20: Indonesia Prez Widodo
81.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo said he got a "strong impression" that Russian President Vladimir Putin wouldn't attend the G20 summit in Bali, based on a conversation last week. Widodo expressed concern that the gathering could be overshadowed by a "very worrying" rise in international tensions. "G20 isn't meant to be a political forum. It's meant to be about...development," he added.

82.title: Nigerian Instagram influencer 'Hushpuppi' jailed for 11 years in US for fraud
82.article_body: Nigerian Instagram influencer Ramon Abbas, also known as 'Hushpuppi', has been jailed for over 11 years in the US for his role in a global theft and a money-laundering scam. Abbas, who flaunted his wealthy lifestyle on his Instagram page, had pleaded guilty in 2021 to money laundering, which included helping North Korean hackers launder stolen money.

83.title: Man allegedly kills his 25-year-old friend in Thane's Bhiwandi; arrested
83.article_body: Thane Police arrested a man for allegedly killing his 25-year-old friend, Shamim, in Bhiwandi while he was sleeping inside his hotel on Monday. "[He was] murdered late at night between 1:30 am and 2:00 am. The accused ran away from the spot…[The] body was lying in a pool of blood [at the hotel's door]," said a police officer.

84.title: Australia announce squad for ODI series against England
84.article_body: Australia have announced their squad for the upcoming ODI series against England. It'll be the first ODI series for Australia under Pat Cummins' captaincy. Travis Head has been included in the squad and is expected to open in the series. He has been selected in place of Aaron Finch, who retired from ODI cricket. The squad also features Cameron Green.

85.title: Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor' with 321 AQI; Noida's AQI at 354
85.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Tuesday morning was recorded in the 'very poor' category with an air quality index (AQI) of 321. The AQI in Noida also stood in the 'very poor' category at 354, while in Gurugram it stood at 326, as per SAFAR's data. The AQI in Delhi on Monday was recorded at 326.

86.title: No skin show, wind machine kept Sridevi's saree flowing: Boney on 'Kate...'
86.article_body: Film producer Boney Kapoor said that there was "not even a slight skin show" in the song 'Kate Nahin Kat Te'. "We [added] red glass house and red mirrors to cleverly picturise that Anil is singing the song." He also said it was the first time a wind machine was used to keep actress Sridevi's hair and saree flowing.

87.title: Never imagined myself doing action: Samantha on 'Yashoda'
87.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who will be seen performing action sequences in her upcoming film 'Yashoda', said she had "never imagined" herself doing action. "My love for the genre has been a revelation to me," she said, adding that performing action offers "an adrenaline rush" and "a sense of accomplishment". 'Yashoda' has been shot in Tamil and Telugu.

88.title: Paytm Q2 net loss widens to ₹571.5 crore y-o-y, revenue up by 76%
88.article_body: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications reported a consolidated loss of ₹571.5 crore for the quarter ended September, widening from a loss of ₹473.5 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. However, the loss narrowed from ₹645.4 crore in Q1 FY23. Its consolidated revenue from operations surged by 76.2% to ₹1,914 crore. A surge in loan growth drove the jump.

89.title: Mobile kitchen van launched for police on VVIP duties in Sangrur
89.article_body: Punjab's Sangrur Police have launched a mobile kitchen van for police deployed on VVIP duties and protest sites. The SSP said that the initiative has been launched as police personnel remain on their duties for hours and don't get time to have meals. There was also a problem in distribution and preparation of food at different places, the SSP added.

90.title: I'm doing much better: Varun on battle with vestibular hypofunction
90.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, who recently opened up about his vestibular hypofunction diagnosis, said he's doing "much better with the help of yoga, swimming...Above all, the blessings of God". He added, "The amount of concern and love that has followed has left me humbled and very energised to get back to 100%." Varun is currently busy with the promotions of 'Bhediya'.

91.title: If people like my pics, I'll get another brand, will pay EMIs with ease: Janhvi
91.article_body: While talking about her social media presence, actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she does not want to take it so seriously and wants to have fun with it. "Hopefully, if I look cute and five extra people like my pictures, I will get another brand and I will be able to pay for my EMIs with more ease," she added.

92.title: Remove K'taka leader over his 'Hindu' remark: BJP leader to Cong
92.article_body: BJP leader Arun Singh has said Congress should remove its KPCC Working President  Satish Jarkiholi if it doesn't agree with his remarks on the word 'Hindu'. In a video, Jarkiholi claimed the word 'Hindu' hails from Persia and added, "You'll be ashamed to know its meaning...its meaning is very dirty." Earlier, Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala had called Jarkiholi's statement unfortunate.

93.title: Mother & son die of dengue, health dept says no death from disease in Mohali
93.article_body: A mother and her son died within a span of 24 hours in Mohali's Abrawan village, with family claiming that both had contracted dengue and subsequently succumbed to the disease. The sarpanch of Abrawan village claimed that their dengue reports had returned positive. However, the Mohali health department said that no dengue deaths had taken place in the district.

94.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of robbing, occupying empty houses in Kherson
94.article_body: Ukraine has accused Russia of robbing and occupying empty houses in the southern city of Kherson. Ukraine has said that Russia's recent order to evacuate civilians from Kherson is forced deportation which amounts to a war crime. Kherson, which had a population of nearly 3,00,000 before the war, has been without electricity and water for over two days.

95.title: US businessman wins record $75 million in legal sports betting history
95.article_body: US businessman Jim McIngvale, known as 'Mattress Mack', has won $75 million in the largest payout in legal sports betting history. He made a series of bets amounting to $10 million on Houston Astros winning baseball World Series. Sharing a photo of himself with a suitcase full of cash on Twitter, the 71-year-old wrote, "How tweet it is 75 million."

96.title: You can resist moonlighting but can't stop it: Former HCL Tech CEO
96.article_body: Former HCL Technologies CEO Vineet Nayar remarked that "moonlighting is an unstoppable event. You can resist it but you can't stop it." Nayar explained that there are three reasons causing moonlighting in the IT sector- the widening gap between the salaries of freshers and top management, the lack of purpose and innovation in IT companies and the growing start-up culture.

97.title: Stones pelted at train in which Owaisi was travelling: AIMIM leader
97.article_body: AIMIM leader Waris Pathan alleged on Monday that stones were pelted at a coach of Vande Bharat Express in which party chief Asaduddin Owaisi was travelling. Owaisi, Pathan and AIMIM Gujarat President Sabir Kabliwala were travelling from Ahmedabad to Surat. Sharing pictures of the incident, he tweeted, "Some unidentified people broke the glass by pelting stones at the train."

98.title: Blockchain startup Dhiway raises $1 million in pre-seed round
98.article_body: Blockchain startup Dhiway has raised $1 million in a pre-seed round led by Cornerstone Venture Partners Fund, SUNiCON Ventures and its existing shareholders. Founded in 2019, the Bengaluru-based startup operates and maintains India's first verifiable data exchange platform, #MARK Studio, that enables companies to deploy governance frameworks to carry these as sustainable digital assets.

99.title: 85 pigs die from African Swine Fever in MP's Katni; survey ongoing
99.article_body: As many as 85 pigs have died from African Swine Fever and 115 others have been infected by the virus in Madhya Pradesh's Katni, an official said on Monday. A survey is being conducted and it's likely to be completed within two days, following which, the infected pigs will be culled, the district's Incharge Deputy Director Veterinary RK Singh said.

100.title: If I was Babar, I'd get hold of the guy making video: Akram on dressing room footage
100.article_body: Reacting to PCB sharing video of Babar Azam's speech in dressing room after Pakistan qualified for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals, Wasim Akram said, "If I was Babar...I'd get hold of the guy making...video." He added, "Some things are personal...I haven’t seen any other team do this in...World Cup...The urge to get extra numbers...cut it down. It’s just too much."

101.title: 'Twitter usage is at an all-time high lol,' tweets Elon Musk
101.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Monday tweeted that the social media platform's "usage is at an all-time high lol". In another tweet he wrote, "I just hope the servers don't melt!" Musk didn't provide any evidence or explain how he defines usage. Twitter has added over 15 million monetisable daily active users (mDAU) since July, The Verge reported.

102.title: 4 including 3 students returning from exam killed as dumper overturns on auto in Maharashtra
102.article_body: As many as four persons, including 3 students, were killed after a dumper full of sand overturned on an auto-rickshaw in Maharashtra's Raigarh, police said. The three students were returning after taking an exam and were killed along with the auto driver on the spot, police added. Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde announced ₹5 lakh financial assistance to the deceased's families.

103.title: 3 killed, 25 injured as tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims overturns on bridge in MP
103.article_body: At least three people were killed while 25 others were injured after a tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims from Bhind district overturned on a bridge in Madhya Pradesh's Datia district. State Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan expressed his condolences. "I pray to God to grant the departed souls a place at his feet and a speedy recovery [for] the injured," he tweeted.

104.title: Actress Rebel Wilson welcomes baby via surrogate; shares 1st pic
104.article_body: Actress Rebel Wilson has announced that she has welcomed her first child, a baby girl named Royce Lillian. In an Instagram post, Wilson said her daughter was born "this past week via surrogate". "I can't even describe the love I have for her, she's a beautiful miracle! I am forever grateful to everyone who has been involved," she wrote.

105.title: 'Stop licking toxic toad,' US govt body warns people, releases pic
105.article_body: The US' National Park Service has warned people against touching or licking toxic Sonoran Desert toad, also known as Colorado River toad. "These toads have prominent parotid glands that secrete a potent toxin. It can make you sick if you handle the frog or get poison in your mouth," it stated. The toxics can cause hallucinations and psychoactive reactions.

106.title: Centre's policies broke backbone of farmers, small businesses: Rahul
106.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised PM Narendra Modi and said that his policies have broken the backbone of small businesses and farmers while benefitting selected businessmen. "Unemployment is increasing in the country…The truth [about] India is that the country cannot give employment to its youth…The government extends all the profit to selected two-three people," said Rahul.

107.title: 26 Congress leaders join BJP ahead of Himachal Pradesh elections
107.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections on November 12, as many as 26 Congress party leaders joined BJP on Monday. BJP leader and Himachal CM Jairam Thakur tweeted, "Customs are changing...many colleagues including former office bearers of Congress...joined BJP." Among those who left Congress includes Dharampal Thakur Khand, former General Secretary of the Pradesh Congress Committee.

108.title: Your business, your decision: Mark Cuban as Musk rejects his advice on $8 blue tick fee
108.article_body: Elon Musk rejected a suggestion by billionaire Mark Cuban regarding offering the $8 verification program to some users for free. Cuban suggested an $8 verification fee could be waived for the "most accurate" users of a new Notes feature to ensure accuracy, to which Musk replied, "$8 for all." Cuban then responded, "Your business. Your decision."

109.title: Noida Traffic Police to give AQI updates on its social media handles
109.article_body: Noida Traffic Police said that it will take steps to regularly update its social media platforms with air quality index (AQI) data as the pollution levels continue to remain in "very poor" category. People don't always get the correct pollution data and most don't even know where to look for official information pertaining to their locality, senior traffic officers said.

110.title: Would hide & watch him perform: Neena on working with Amitabh Bachchan
110.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta revealed that she "would hide and watch" Amitabh Bachchan perform on the sets of 'Uunchai'. "I addressed him as Amit bhai. He is the most committed and amazing actor. Kaam hi unki tapasya hai (Work is worship for him)," she said. Neena was previously seen sharing screen space with Amitabh Bachchan in Vikas Bahl's 'Goodbye'.

111.title: Rohit's getting out trying to execute concept which he started: Gavaskar
111.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Rohit Sharma is getting dismissed while trying to score as much as possible in the powerplay during the T20 World Cup 2022, terming it as a concept which Rohit started. "Rohit has set this template...to go bang, bang and bang. Suddenly, he can't be seen looking to work the ball around," added Gavaskar.

112.title: NCP leader stops screening of Marathi film on Chhatrapati Shivaji in Thane
112.article_body: NCP leader Jitendra Awhad forcefully stopped screening of Marathi movie 'Har Har Mahadev' at a multiplex in Thane on Monday night alleging that the movie showcases wrong history about Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Awhad's supporters also allegedly manhandled viewer who tried to stop them. People are influenced by movies and we won't let them change history, the former Maharashtra minister said.

113.title: USFDA finds procedural lapses at Lupin's Nagpur injectables facility
113.article_body: US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) issued a Form-483 after finding procedural lapses at Lupin's injectables manufacturing facility in Nagpur. The USFDA conducted the inspection from October 17-29 and found lapses on five counts, including flooring, walls and ceiling of the aseptic processing areas at the facility. "We're committed to addressing the observations at the earliest," Lupin said.

114.title: If Pak win T20 WC, Raja shouldn't claim credit for team selection: Amir
114.article_body: Talking about PCB chief Ramiz Raja, ex-Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir said, "It's a request to [him] that if Pakistan win, then...[he shouldn't]...say [he] selected this team." "When the team was losing...everyone was hiding. Don't fool us. We all know where the selection...[went] wrong," added Amir. Amir earlier termed the selection of Pakistan's squad for T20 World Cup 2022 as "poor".

115.title: Hyd's 50% rescued snakes are venomous, learned to stay with humans: Report
115.article_body: Fifty per cent of snakes rescued in Hyderabad are venomous cobras who genetically learned to stay alongside humans, reports said. Avinash Viswanathan, General Secretary of Friends of Snakes Society (FoSS), said that the snakes tend to come out in the month of October. He said that the sightings become more and rescue calls come from various locations in the city.

116.title: They took out 3 bullets from my right leg: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan
116.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Monday claimed that three bullets were taken out of his right leg while some shrapnel was left inside his left leg after he was attacked last week. He claimed the attack against him was conceived two months ago and blamed the incumbent government for the attack. "It was a planned assassination attempt," he added.

117.title: IFS officer shares pics of Puri beaches covered with flowers
117.article_body: IFS officer Susanta Nanda has shared pictures of two beaches in Odisha's Puri covered with flowers. "The 'Beach of flowers'. Puri has two stretch of cleanest & most serene beaches- Golden & Niladri. Move over the Valley of flowers...Sand dunes covered with natural sand binders in full bloom," he tweeted. Golden Beach has received the Blue Flag certification.

118.title: People offer namaz on street in Ghaziabad; FIR filed against imam
118.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have filed an FIR against the imam of a mosque in Khoda for allegedly violating prohibitory orders after taking suo motu cognisance of a picture of people offering namaz on a street in the area. "About 25-30 people came late for...Friday prayers and on not finding space in the mosque, they offered the namaz on...street," the imam claimed.

119.title: 3 held for burglary at mobile phone shops in Pune, 97 devices recovered
119.article_body: Pune City Police arrested three persons for burglary at mobile phone shops and recovered 97 stolen phones worth ₹22 lakh from their possession. This comes after a man filed an FIR claiming that 109 cell phones were stolen from his shop at Uruli Devachi. Apart from cell phones, police also recovered a car and a two-wheeler from the accused.

120.title: Man gets hit by car after jumping from window of bus, dies in Pune
120.article_body: A 24-year-old man died after he was hit by a car as he jumped out onto the road from the window of a bus in Pune's Hadapsar, police said. The incident took place when a quarrel broke out between the passengers inside the bus and people who were waiting outside. A case was filed against the unidentified car driver.

121.title: UK PM Rishi Sunak rushed out of room by aides at climate summit; video goes viral
121.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak was rushed out of the room by his aides at the climate summit on Monday, with a video going viral on social media. It is unclear what information Sunak received from his aides. The United Nations Climate Change Conference, commonly referred to as COP27, opened in the Egyptian resort town of Sharm el-Sheikh on Sunday.

122.title: Read on social media, got no order copy: Cong on Twitter account blocking
122.article_body: After a court in Karnataka asked Twitter to temporarily block the accounts of Congress and Bharat Jodo Yatra on Monday, the party took to Twitter to say that no copy of the order has been received. "We have read on social media about an adverse order from a Bengaluru court against INC & BJY SM handles," the tweet read.

123.title: Brazil announce their 26-man squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup
123.article_body: Brazil have announced their 26-man squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup, which will begin on November 20 in Qatar. Brazil manager Tite has included 39-year-old defender Daniel Alves in the squad, while he has left out Liverpool forward Roberto Firmino. The squad includes Neymar and Thiago Silva. As many as 12 players in the squad feature in the Premier League.

124.title: Ex-Twitter employee gets 10-yr anniversary gift from company days after being fired
124.article_body: A former Twitter manager revealed that she received a 10-year congratulatory anniversary gift from the company days after she was fired. The note read, "Congrats on reaching a huge Tweep milestone. We can't wait to see all that you accomplish this year." Elaine Filadelfo had earlier tweeted, "This is a brutal way to go after 10 years."

125.title: Delhi at 33°C records highest max temperature for November since 2008
125.article_body: Delhi on Monday recorded a maximum temperature of 33°C, making it the warmest November day in the national capital since 2008, as per India Meteorological Department (IMD). Delhi on November 4, 2008, had recorded a maximum temperature of 33.5°C, the IMD data showed. Notably, IMD has predicted that light rain is expected in Delhi towards the end of the week.

126.title: Tyson Foods CFO enters stranger's home, passes out in her bed in US; arrested
126.article_body: John Tyson, the 32-year-old CFO of Tyson Foods, was arrested for criminal trespassing and public intoxication in the US on Sunday. Tyson was found asleep in the bed of a college-aged woman at around 2 am, according to a police report. The woman called police about a potential burglary, who later arrived to find Tyson's clothing strewn on the floor.

127.title: Flipkart's losses widen 46% to over ₹7,800 crore in FY22
127.article_body: Flipkart's losses widened 46% to over ₹7,800 crore in the FY 2021-22, according to regulatory filings. The figure is based on the combined performance of its business-to-business unit Flipkart India and B2C e-commerce unit Flipkart Internet. Flipkart Internet has reported a widening of loss to ₹4,399 crore in FY22, while Flipkart India reported a widening of loss to ₹3,413 crore.

128.title: Congress Wide Ball, AAP No Ball, BJP good length delivery: Rajnath
128.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh used cricket analogies to criticise opposition parties, dubbing Congress a "Wide Ball" and AAP a "No Ball". He added that the BJP is the only "good length delivery" on the pitch of politics. Singh further said that the BJP's promise to implement the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in Himachal Pradesh is not to get votes.

129.title: Kerala govt & CPI(M) exploring legal options against Guv: Yechury
129.article_body: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said that the party and Kerala government are exploring legal options against state Governor Arif Mohammed Khan. "Constitution is clear that the Governor has to act on the guidance of the Cabinet...If he is violating it, then it needs a solution," said Yechury. He added that the Governor spends most of his time in Delhi.

130.title: BJP has formed a PIL gang in Jharkhand HC: CM Hemant Soren
130.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren alleged that the BJP has "formed a PIL gang" in the Jharkhand High Court. "I have come to know that the gang first tries to strike a deal...very unfortunate that sometimes they get protection from the court," said Soren. He added the Opposition has "no face" to hold protests as the Supreme Court gave him relief.

131.title: NIA searches 3 locations in Kerala in PFI conspiracy case
131.article_body: The NIA on Monday conducted searches at three locations in Kerala's Malappuram district in connection with the PFI conspiracy case, the agency informed. The case pertains to the conspiracy hatched by the PFI members to carry out terror acts in the country, an official said. Incriminating materials, including digital devices and documents, were recovered during the searches, the agency added.

132.title: Thrash BJP workers: Jharkhand Congress leader to UPA supporters
132.article_body: Jharkhand Congress Working President Bandhu Tirkey asked UPA supporters to "thrash" BJP workers "if required". Asking party workers to "expose the BJP", Tirkey said the UPA is not "against any investigation" as long as it is not "done with political vendetta". BJP National Vice-President Raghubar Das responded and said, "BJP workers do not get thrashed...Don't touch them even by mistake."

133.title: Probably forgot to fill fuel: Priyanka on BJP's 'double engine' govt
133.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi said that BJP's double engine government probably forgot to fill fuel in it, as it didn't fulfil promises of unemployment in Himachal Pradesh. Speaking at a rally, Priyanka said, "They (BJP) will say anything to stay in power but they forget after polls." Elections in the state will be on November 12.

134.title: Future F1 battles with Lewis Hamilton will be interesting: Verstappen
134.article_body: Current F1 world champion Max Verstappen said the prospect of competing with Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton in the future "will be interesting". "As long as he wants to keep racing, he has to keep doing that," said Verstappen, responding to reports of Hamilton's contract extension. He added that it would be interesting to see which teams "compete at the top".

135.title: Rahul running around country since I dispatched him from Amethi: Irani
135.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Monday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been running and going around the country since she dispatched him from Uttar Pradesh's Amethi. "[Congress] took out [Bharat Jodo Yatra] with those who put resolutions of separating Kashmir from India," Irani said. Congress took out Yatra with those who slaughtered cows and then uploaded photos, she added.

136.title: Annoyed by double standards: Qatar on Germany amid FIFA WC criticism
136.article_body: Qatar's Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammed commented after German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser criticised Qatar for its alleged poor human rights record ahead of the FIFA World Cup 2022. "Annoyed by [German's] double standards...The German population is misinformed by politicians...on the other, the government has no problem with us when it comes to energy partnerships or investment," Sheikh said.

137.title: Stubble burning incidents in Punjab cross 30,000 mark: Data
137.article_body: After 2,487 stubble-burning cases were reported on Monday, the cumulative farm fire cases rose to 32,486 in Punjab from September 15 to November 7, according to the Ludhiana-based Punjab Remote Sensing Centre data. On Monday, Ferozepur (353) witnessed the highest number of incidents followed by Moga (268), the data said. Punjab reported 37,933 incidents during the same period in 2021.

138.title: 19-yr-old Rune defeats Novak Djokovic to win Paris Masters title
138.article_body: Danish teenager Holger Rune defeated Novak Djokovic 3-6 6-3 7-5 to win his first Masters title in Paris. "You're one of my favourite players, I've watched you since I was a kid," said the 19-year-old to Djokovic after the match. Rune, who beat four other top-10 players en route to the final, will now move into the Top 10 rankings.

139.title: Want to see India alongside Brazil at a FIFA World Cup very soon: Cafu
139.article_body: Two-time World Cup-winning Brazilian footballer Cafu said he wants to see India playing in the tournament along with his national side "very soon". Cafu, who visited Hooghly in West Bengal, said he was moved by the love of Indian people for football. The former full-back spent time with fans during his visit and also played football with children.

140.title: 12 injured after bus hits container, causes 6 vehicle pile-up in Pune
140.article_body: At least 12 persons sustained injuries after a bus hit a container on Katraj viaduct on the Mumbai-Bengaluru Highway in Pune on Monday night. "Because of this accident, a pile-up was reported with at least five to six vehicles ramming into one another. The injured persons from the bus have been shifted to a nearby private hospital," police said.

141.title: Russian called 'Putin's chef' admits interfering in US polls, says 'will keep doing it'
141.article_body: A Russian oligarch who is known as 'Putin's chef', when asked about Russian interference in US elections, said, "We have interfered, are interfering and will continue to interfere." Yevgeny Prigozhin added the interference will continue "carefully, precisely, surgically and in our own way". Prigozhin has been accused of sponsoring Russia-based 'troll farms' that seek to impact US politics.

142.title: What is SP's new excuse for bypoll defeat in UP: Mayawati
142.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati asked the Samajwadi Party what their new excuse was for defeat in the Gola Gokarannath Assembly bypolls, given that her party didn't contest. BJP won the bypoll seat, defeating Samajwadi Party by over 34,000 votes, a senior official said. Mayawati's remarks come after the SP blamed the BSP for defeat in the February-March Assembly elections.

143.title: ICC shares list of 10 fastest deliveries bowled in T20 World Cup 2022
143.article_body: The ICC has shared a list of the 10 fastest deliveries bowled in T20 World Cup 2022 so far. England pacer Mark Wood has bowled six of the 10 fastest deliveries in the tournament, including the fastest delivery of the tournament which was clocked at 154.74 kmph against New Zealand. New Zealand's Lockie Ferguson bowled the second-fastest delivery (154.55 kmph).

144.title: Eknath Shinde govt will fall in coming months: Aaditya Thackeray
144.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Aaditya Thackeray said the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra Government will collapse in the coming months. "Midterm polls are around the corner," said Thackeray, asking party workers to gear up for early elections. He added that ever since an "unconstitutional government" was formed in the state, there is no one to listen to farmers and youths.

145.title: PM Modi will unveil logo, theme of India's G20 presidency on Nov 8
145.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will unveil the theme, logo and website of India's G20 presidency via video conferencing on November 8, the Ministry of External Affairs said. "The logo, theme and website of our G20 presidency would reflect India's message and overarching priorities to the world," the ministry added. India will assume the G20 presidency from December 1, 2022.

146.title: Rajasthan woman, her lover get life term for husband's murder
146.article_body: A court in Rajasthan's Baran district on Monday awarded life imprisonment to a 25-year-old woman and her lover for the murder of her husband in 2017. The victim, Nirmal Malav, was found dead behind a school in Khajuria village. During investigation, it was revealed that Nirmal's wife, Seema, had been in a relationship with co-convict Surendra since before her marriage.

147.title: Amnesty warns jailed activist may die during COP27 in Egypt
147.article_body: Amnesty International chief Agnes Callamard on Sunday said that jailed Egyptian-British political activist Alaa Abdel Fattah could die amid the COP27 international climate summit as a result of his hunger strike. Callamard warned that Fattah had only 72 hours to live after he escalated his hunger strike by also refusing water. Egypt is hosting the COP27, which opened on Sunday.

148.title: Dravid, Rohit and Kohli give up business class seats for Team India fast bowlers
148.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid, captain Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli gave up their designated business class seats for fast bowlers amid T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia so that they get adequate legroom on flights. "Before the tournament...we decided...since pacers clock...maximum mileage on field...they need to stretch their legs," a support staff member told Indian Express.

149.title: Producer Subaskaran said yes to 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' in 2 minutes: Mani
149.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam has revealed that when he had a conversation with producer Subaskaran about 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', he agreed to back the film within two minutes under the banner Lyca Productions. He also thanked the entire crew for relentlessly working on the film. 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' has reportedly collected about ₹500 crore worldwide.

150.title: Ticket prices slashed for Puneeth's last film 'Gandhada Gudi' in Karnataka
150.article_body: Late actor Puneeth Rajkumar's wife Ashwini on Sunday announced that the ticket prices for his last film 'Gandhada Gudi' will be slashed from Monday to Thursday across Karnataka. She added that the film will be shown on single screens for ₹56 while it will be shown in multiplexes for ₹112. The film is a documentary on the wildlife of Karnataka.

151.title: Ex-BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's brother-in-law arrested in money laundering case
151.article_body: Enforcement Directorate has arrested Atif Raza, brother-in-law of ex-BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari, in a money laundering case against Ansari and his family. The case pertains to a godown built illegally on government land in Uttar Pradesh's Mau by Vikas Construction, a firm run by Ansari, Raza and other family members. Ansari's son Abbas Ansari was earlier arrested in the case.

152.title: Don't worry we won't let you down: Chinese Prez to Pak PM amid financial crisis
152.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has assured Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif of support amid a financial crisis, Pakistan's Finance Minister Ishaq Dar said. Dar quoted Xi as saying, "Don't worry, we will not let you down," during a November 3 meeting with Sharif. China has offered $9 billion (around ₹74,000 crore) bailout package to Pakistan.

153.title: EWS ruling setback for century-long social justice struggle: TN CM
153.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said the Supreme Court's decision to uphold 10% reservation for the Economically Weaker Sections is "a setback" for the century-long social justice struggle. He added that legal experts would be consulted and a decision would be taken on the next steps. "Unite to make the voice of social justice resound throughout the country," said Stalin.

154.title: Video shows 4 women punching, kicking 25-yr-old woman in MP; 3 booked
154.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing four women kicking and punching a 25-year-old woman in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. The video shows the accused attacking the victim with a belt. Police said the accused also broke the victim's mobile phone by slamming it on the road. Police added that three women, aged 18-22, have been named in the complaint and booked.

155.title: 59-year-old man dies after being attacked by bull in UP's Amethi
155.article_body: A man died after being attacked by a bull in an area under Mohanganj Police Station in Amethi, UP. The deceased, Ramkrishna Yadav, was attacked in his farmland after he had gone there to chase away the bovine, police said. Yadav, who was a fourth-class employee at the secretariat in Lucknow, was severely injured in the stomach after the attack.

156.title: 2 Rath Yatras to be held after Jana Sankalpa Yatra: Karnataka CM
156.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said the BJP will conduct two 'Rath Yatra' in the state after the ongoing Jana Sankalpa Yatra. He added that one 'Rath Yatra' will cover south Karnataka Assembly constituencies and the other will be in north Karnataka constituencies. Bommai added that the Jana Sankalpa Yatra has helped organise the party at the grassroots level.

157.title: Sridevi was sick when we shot 'Kate Nahin Kat Te' song: Boney Kapoor
157.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor has revealed that the 'Kate Nahin Kat Te' song in 'Mr India' was shot in 21 days. "Sridevi fell sick during the shoot for 2-3 days but...shot the song with a temperature," he added. He also said the song initially was set to feature just Sridevi, however, Anil Kapoor requested he should be part of the song.

158.title: There's always stress in life due to work, money, relationship: Arbaaz
158.article_body: Actor Arbaaz Khan has said that people always go through stress in their life. "There's always some stress or the other because of work, money, relationship or health. This goes on for the entire life. You can never stay without stress in all aspects of your life forever," he added. Arbaaz said the point is to balance the stress.

159.title: Supreme Court is casteist: Congress leader Udit Raj on EWS verdict
159.article_body: Congress leader Udit Raj called the Supreme Court "casteist" for upholding the 10% reservation for the Economically Weaker Section (EWS) in higher education and employment. Raj added that he wasn't "against the reservation of poor upper castes". He said he is commenting because the SC refused to increase reservations for SC/ST, OBCs citing the "Constitution's limit of 50%".

160.title: Dalit man lynched over drawing water from tubewell in Raj; 3 held
160.article_body: A 46-year-old Dalit man was beaten to death over drawing water from a tubewell in Rajasthan's Jodhpur, police said on Monday. The accused also hurled casteist slurs at him and didn't allow his family members to take him to a hospital, the victim's brother alleged. So far, police have detained three people in this connection.

161.title: RBI should let rupee depreciate, use forex reserves judiciously: CEA
161.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran said that the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) should allow the rupee to depreciate gradually and foreign exchange reserves should be used judiciously. "We should augment foreign exchange reserves and that will help with any contingencies," Nageswaran added. India's foreign reserves have fallen from $642 billion to $531 billion.

162.title: Elon Musk recommends voting for Republicans in US mid-term elections
162.article_body: Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "To independent-minded voters: Shared power curbs the worst excesses of both parties, therefore I recommend voting for a Republican Congress, given that the Presidency is Democratic." He added, "Independent voters...actually decide who's in charge!" Several people criticised Musk, who earlier said, "For Twitter to deserve public trust, it must be politically neutral."

163.title: BJP to win 55 of 60 seats in 2023 Tripura polls: Assam CM Himanta
163.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that BJP will win 55 out of 60 seats in the next year's Tripura Assembly elections. "When BJP won the second term in Assam, the Delhi people admitted that the party has cemented its permanent base in the Northeast," CM Sarma said. He added that BJP will also win Meghalaya and Nagaland.

164.title: Teachings of Sikh Gurus like beacon of light showing way to world: PM
164.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday extended wishes on occasion of Gurpurab. He said, "The guidance that the country received from Guruvani centuries ago is also a tradition, a belief and a vision of a developed India for us today." PM Modi added that Guru Nanak's life and teachings of Sikh Gurus are like beacon of light showing way to world.

165.title: Akshay Kumar was to play Karan Tacker's role in 'Khakee: The...': Report
165.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar was reportedly set to play the role of police officer Amit Lodha in 'Khakee: The Bihar Chapter'. As per a source, "Khakee was...conceptualised as a film...Akshay was offered the role of Amit Lodha, the honest...sincere police officer." "The film turned into a show and Karan Tacker was roped in for the same character," the source added.

166.title: Disposed of 10,000 cases: Outgoing CJI Lalit in farewell speech
166.article_body: Outgoing Chief Justice of India Uday Umesh Lalit, speaking at the farewell function organised by the Supreme Court Bar Association on Monday, said, "My journey began from this court and today it ends in the same court." "Since I took over, we disposed of 10,000 cases," he added. Justice DY Chandrachud will take over as India's 50th CJI.

167.title: Priyanka visits Lucknow to observe work done by UNICEF, shares videos
167.article_body: Priyanka Chopra on Monday visited Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh to see the work being done by UNICEF and its partners to end violence and discrimination against girls in the state. She also shared a series of videos of herself visiting several UNICEF centres. She also paid a visit to Composite School Aurangabad and an Anganwadi centre where she interacted with children.

168.title: I seek inspiration; Allu Arjun is amazing, Yash was great with KGF: Varun
168.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, speaking about actors in the South, said he just seeks inspiration. "Allu Arjun is amazing...Yash has done great with 'KGF' [franchise]...if you see, 'Kantara', the way the film has been written, directed and acted by the same person, Rishab Shetty," he added. He stated that it is a good time to have collaborations between the industries.

169.title: Qatar accuses Germany of 'double standards' after minister's remarks
169.article_body: Qatar's Foreign Minister on Monday accused Germany of displaying "double standards" after its interior minister said major sporting events' hosts should be selected as per certain standards, such as human rights compliance. Germany "has no problem with Qatar when it comes to energy partnerships", Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani retorted. Notably, Qatar will be hosting the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

170.title: PM Modi shares pictures of Dev Diwali from Kashi, calls them 'magnificent'
170.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday took to Twitter to share pictures of Dev Diwali from Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi and addressed the city with its ancient name, 'Kashi'. "Dev Diwali is special and Dev Diwali in Kashi is even more memorable," the PM tweeted. "Have a look at these magnificent pictures from the eternal city of Kashi," he added.

171.title: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorm warning issued for several states for next few days
171.article_body: As per IMD, heavy rainfall is very likely over Andaman & Nicobar Islands on November 8. It is very likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on November 10 and 11 and over Andhra Pradesh on November 11. Further, thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is likely over Himachal Pradesh and UTs like Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh on November 9 and 10.

172.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
172.article_body: Katihar in Bihar had the highest AQI of 360 among 163 Indian cities on Monday, as per data released by the Central Pollution Control Board. Delhi's AQI stood at 354, Noida's stood at 328 and Ghaziabad's stood at 304. Begusarai (Bihar), Ballabgarh, Faridabad, Kaithal and Gurugram in Haryana and Gwalior (MP) were also among the most polluted cities on Monday.

173.title: It is definitely in pipeline: Arbaaz Khan on 'Dabangg 4'
173.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan has confirmed that Dabangg's fourth instalment is in the pipeline. "The period between Dabangg 3 and 4 won't be as long as between...second and third instalments," he added. Arbaaz further said he and Salman Khan want to do the film "with a lot of love".  'Dabangg 2' and 'Dabangg 3' were released in 2012 and 2019 respectively.

174.title: Wanted criminal gifts stolen dog to girlfriend in Chennai, arrested
