174.article_body: A 21-year-old wanted criminal, accused of stealing bikes and batteries, was caught by the Greater Chennai Police on Sunday when he attempted to gift a stolen dog to his girlfriend. The accused was addicted to marijuana, police said. Furthermore, while working with a popular grocery delivery brand, he stole several items while delivering items.

175.title: Video shows youths drinking alcohol, smoking outside school in UP
175.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a group of five-six boys drinking alcohol and smoking cigarettes outside a district school in UP's Sitapur. In the video, the face of one of the men can be seen, while others can be seen looking away from the camera. The Sitapur Police took cognisance of the case and are investigating the matter.

176.title: Billie Eilish makes red carpet debut with boyfriend in Gucci blanket and pyjamas
176.article_body: Singer Billie Eilish made her red carpet debut with her singer-boyfriend Jesse James Rutherford at the LACMA Art + Film Gala in Los Angeles. The couple appeared on the red carpet wrapped in a Gucci blanket and wore pyjama-inspired Gucci outfits. The 20-year-old 'Bad Guy' singer, Eilish, and the 31-year-old singer Rutherford, recently made their relationship public.

177.title: Will talk about 3 garbage mountains that BJP has created in Delhi: AAP
177.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming MCD polls, AAP's Durgesh Pathak said that during their campaign, they will talk about the "three garbage mountains" that BJP has created in Delhi. "BJP got three chances...[and] they couldn't resolve the garbage issue in 15 years," Pathak said. Another AAP leader Gopal Rai said that the party will be focusing on the issue of garbage.

178.title: Britannia shares jump 10% on robust Q2 results, m-cap hits ₹1 lakh cr
178.article_body: Britannia Industries Ltd shares jumped 10% to hit a record high of ₹4,181 apiece on the BSE in Monday's early deals after the company reported strong quarterly earnings. With this, the company's market capitalisation surpassed the ₹1 lakh crore mark. Notably, Britannia's reported a 28.4% jump in consolidated net profit at ₹490.58 crore for the second quarter ending September 30.

179.title: Tamil Nadu board date sheet announced, exams to start from March 13
179.article_body: Tamil Nadu School Education Department has announced dates for board exams for Classes 10 to 12. Exams will start from March 13 next year. Class 10 exams will be held from April 6 to 20, Class 11 exams will be conducted from March 14 to April 5, while Class 12 exams will be held from March 13 to April 3.

180.title: Co-working firm Awfis plans December 2023 IPO
180.article_body: Co-working company Awfis is planning its initial public offering (IPO) for December 2023, Founder and CEO Amit Ramani said. Adding that Awfis has raised nearly ₹450 crore, he said that the IPO will give exits to investors. Ramani added that while their revenue grew to ₹280 crore in the last financial year, they are targeting ₹600 crore revenue this fiscal.

181.title: Reviewer once wrote I'm 5 kg too heavy to be mainstream heroine: Huma Qureshi
181.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi revealed that a person once made a "very personal comment" about her while reviewing one of her films. "Somebody wrote in the review...'Huma Qureshi is a lovely actress but maybe she's 5 kgs too heavy to be a mainstream heroine'," she stated. Huma added that the comment was "very heartbreaking" and "demoralizing" for her.

182.title: Sula Vineyards gets SEBI approval for IPO
182.article_body: Nashik-based Sula Vineyards has received approval from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for its initial public offering (IPO). Sula had filed its papers with the market regulator in July. According to the papers, the IPO will be entirely an offer for sale (OFS) with up to 25,546,186 equity shares put up for sale.

183.title: German midwife accused of causing stillbirth goes on trial
183.article_body: A 61-year-old midwife, who has been accused of causing a stillbirth by being too slow to seek additional assistance during a difficult home delivery in 2015, went on trial in Germany on Monday. The incident occurred in a remote village in Siedenburg. The prosecution argues that the midwife should have been quicker to recognize the risk to the child's life.

184.title: Shankar to direct biggest pan-India film after 'Baahubali' with Ranveer: Report
184.article_body: Filmmaker Shankar will reportedly direct the biggest pan-India film after SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' franchise. The project will feature actor Ranveer Singh. As per the source, the film will be an adaptation of the Tamil novel 'Velpari' and will be a three-film franchise. "This would be the biggest film of Shankar and Ranveer's filmography to date," the source added.

185.title: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia summoned to Assam over defamation case
185.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has been summoned to Assam over a defamation case. Sisodia had allegedly said Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma had awarded an urgent contract for supplying PPE kits at rates higher than market prices to his wife's firm in 2020. The defamation complaint was filed by Sarma under Sections 499, 500 and 501 of IPC.

186.title: Ban on drones, helicopters, paragliding ahead of PM's Himachal visit
186.article_body: A complete ban on paragliding, drones, helicopters and other aerial objects has been imposed ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district, officials said. DM Nipun Jindal said the decision has been taken in view of the PM's security. The ban will be in effect from 5 pm on November 8 to 5 pm on November 9.

187.title: 6 arrested for raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogan in UP
187.article_body: Six men were arrested for allegedly raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogan in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh after a meeting of BSP workers. The meeting was held to discuss the local bodies poll last week. Police said an FIR has been registered against them for taking out a procession without permission and raising slogans.

188.title: Botswana wins bid to host 'conflict diamond' watchdog's secretariat
188.article_body: Botswana has won the bid to host the permanent secretariat of the Kimberley Process (KP), a coalition of governments, civil societies and the diamond industry, which ensures "conflict diamonds" don't enter the mainstream diamond market. "Conflict diamonds" are the diamonds used to fund rebel groups seeking to undermine legitimate governments. KP's secretariat is expected to be operational by 2024.

189.title: 76-year-old singer Cher confirms relationship with 36-year-old Alexander Edwards
189.article_body: Singer Cher has confirmed her relationship with 36-year-old music producer Alexander Edwards. The 76-year-old artiste shared a picture of her new partner on Twitter and stated that he treats her "like a queen". In response to those criticising their 40-year age gap, she tweeted, "I am not defending us. Haters are gonna hate...Doesn't matter that we're happy and not bothering."

190.title: Anurag Kashyap in talks to play Vijay Mallya in 'File No 323': Report
190.article_body: Anurag Kashyap is in advanced talks to portray fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya in an upcoming movie titled, 'File No 323', according to a report. The forthcoming project will reportedly be directed by Karthik K. "[The director] has a certain vision to make the film on a grand scale and...he'll be presenting...Mallya with complete flamboyance," a source was quoted as saying.

191.title: 10 soldiers killed as al-Shabab attacks military base in Somalia
191.article_body: At least 10 soldiers were killed in an assault on a military base by al-Shabab fighters in Somalia's Galgaduud region on Monday, a military official said. The army managed to push the militants out of the base and move the fighting to the jungles, he added. The attack took place in a village captured from al-Shabab last week, authorities informed.

192.title: 12 state-run banks post 50% jump in Q2 profit at ₹25,685 crore: FM
192.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that 12 public sector banks reported a 50% jump in combined net profit at ₹25,685 crore in the second quarter ended September. "The continuous efforts of...government for reducing the NPAs and...strengthening the health of PSBs are now showing tangible results," she tweeted. Notably, SBI posted the highest-ever profit of ₹13,265 crore in Q2.

193.title: 'K.G.F: Chapter 3' not happening anytime soon: Yash
193.article_body: Actor Yash, during an event, shared that 'K.G.F: Chapter 3' is not happening anytime soon. "Because for 6-7 years I've been doing that (playing Rocky in KGF films). We'll...take a break and see if everything falls into place. We'll do it later," he added. While the first part was released in 2018, the second instalment arrived in theatres in 2022.

194.title: Will compose music for film that stands for something: Grammy-winner Ricky
194.article_body: Two-time Grammy Award winner Ricky Kej has said he will love to compose music for films that have a message in them. "I only make music that stands for something...I wrapped up a Malayalam film, 'Adrishya Jalakangal', which is an anti-war film," he stated. "I want to compose [music] for films across languages...they need to stand for something," he added.

195.title: Jimmy Kimmel to host Oscars for 3rd time, says 'It's either a great honor or a trap'
195.article_body: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS) has announced that television host Jimmy Kimmel will be hosting the 95th Academy Awards next year. Kimmel had earlier hosted Oscars in 2017 and 2018. "Being invited to host the Oscars for a third time is either a great honor or a trap," Kimmel said.

196.title: Elderly couple electrocuted to death in front of Chennai apartment
196.article_body: An elderly couple was electrocuted to death in front of their apartment building's gate in Chennai's Kodambakkam. Police said the initial investigation shows a short-circuit in the live wire for the light fixture placed on top of the main gate might have caused the electrocution. A neighbour, who tried to lift the deceased woman, received a jolt in his hand.

197.title: Pak climbed from bottom to top in 1992 ODI WC as well: Inzamam
197.article_body: After Pakistan qualified for the semifinals of the T20 World Cup, ex-skipper Inzamam-ul-Haq said that the team's performance in the semifinals and final will be better than the Super 12 stage round. "This time in Australia, Pakistan climbed from bottom to top. Even during the 1992 World Cup, Pakistan did the same and climbed from bottom to top," Inzamam said.

198.title: Unacademy lays off 350 employees, CEO says 'I take complete responsibility'
198.article_body: Edtech unicorn Unacademy is laying off 10% of its workforce, or about 350 employees, in its second round of layoffs this year. In an email to employees, Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal said, "This decision has not been easy and I take complete responsibility." Citing Unacademy's commitment to no layoffs, Munjal said, "Market challenges have forced us to reevaluate our decisions."

199.title: Twitter accounts of Cong, Bharat Jodo Yatra to be blocked over use of 'KGF 2' songs
199.article_body: A Bengaluru court has ordered that the Twitter accounts of the Indian National Congress and 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' be temporarily blocked over alleged copyright infringement. The action was ordered over the alleged illegal use of sound records of 'KGF: Chapter 2'. An FIR was filed against Rahul Gandhi on a complaint by MRT Music over the use of sound records.

200.title: Ranbir taught me to use specific perfume while playing character: Sanjana
200.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi has revealed that actor Ranbir Kapoor, during the 'Rockstar' shoot, taught her to use specific perfume while she is playing her character. She further added that doing this "really helps" her. Sanjana, who recently featured in 'Rashtra Kavach Om' along with Aditya Roy Kapur, will next feature in 'Dhak Dhak'.

201.title: Elon Musk goes to trial over his $56 bn Tesla pay package
201.article_body: Elon Musk is being taken to trial over his $56 billion Tesla pay package which shareholder claims the CEO created to fund his dream of colonising Mars. The pay package allows Musk to purchase 1% of discounted Tesla stock when financial targets are met. Tesla defended the pay package saying that it delivered extraordinary 10-fold increase in value to shareholders.

202.title: 11 lakh diyas lit on ghats in UP's Prayagraj on Dev Deepawali
202.article_body: Eleven lakh diyas were lit on the ghats of Ganga, Yamuna and Sangam in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj on the occasion of Dev Deepawali on Monday. Several devotees took a dip at Sangam and special programmes were held on various ghats of the city. CM Yogi Adityanath congratulated people on the occasion.

203.title: Musk-appointed engineer Sriram shares 4 reasons to defend Twitter's $8 fee
203.article_body: Sriram Krishnan, the Indian-origin engineer advising Elon Musk on Twitter, defended the $8 verification fee. He tweeted, "Everyone caught impersonating will lose their money," and added, "$8 gives a consistent path for anyone regardless of their level of notability". He also said blue tick will reduce spam issues and will validate "this person is who they say they are".

204.title: Ashwin was himself embarrassed with his wickets, he was hiding his face: Kapil Dev
204.article_body: India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev has said that Ravichandran Ashwin hasn't yet been in the rhythm one expects him to be in. "He picked up wickets [against Zimbabwe] but it didn't look as if he got them. One or two wickets that he took, he himself was embarrassed to claim those...He was hiding his face," Kapil Dev added.

205.title: Kerala Muslim women burn hijab in solidarity with protestors in Iran
205.article_body: A group of Muslim women on Sunday burnt hijabs in Kerala's Kozhikode in solidarity with the anti-hijab movement in Iran, during a seminar which was organised by Kerala Yukthivadi Sangham. "We held a day-long seminar...and paid rich tributes to Mahsa Amini, who was tortured to death by the morality police in Tehran in September," one of the event organisers said.

206.title: You'll be ashamed to know meaning of 'Hindu', it's dirty: Cong leader
206.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader Satish Laxmanrao Jarkiholi on Sunday claimed that the word 'Hindu' hails from Persia and not India. In a video, the Congress leader can be heard saying, "Where has 'Hindu' term come from? It's come from Persia...what is its relation with India? How's 'Hindu' yours?" "You'll be ashamed to know its meaning...its meaning is very dirty," he added.

207.title: Didn't make action films: Barjatya on Rajshri not working with Big B
207.article_body: Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya, speaking about his production company Rajshri never working with Amitabh Bachchan before 'Uunchai', said they were making "non-star-cast movies" in the 70s. "We weren't making action films and Bachchan sir had an action hero image," he added. "Jaya ji has done two films with us. Abhishek did 'Main Prem Ki Diwani Hoon' with us," he stated.

208.title: Indonesia says freeing ship stranded in its water might take a month
208.article_body: Indonesia on Monday said it could take a month to free an oil tanker that ran aground in its water on October 26. The Indonesian Navy has been engaged in efforts to free the Djibouti-registered ship, Young Yong. Notably, the vessel was slapped with sanctions by the US on November 3 for alleged links with Hezbollah and Iran's Quds Force.

209.title: Maha Minister abuses NCP's Supriya Sule on TV, Shinde camp issues apology
209.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena issued an apology after Maharashtra Minister Abdul Sattar abused NCP leader and Sharad Pawar's daughter, Supriya Sule, during a televised interview. NCP workers, in a complaint, alleged that Sattar "insulted the entire woman community of the country" when he was asked about the 'khoke' jibe, implying an exchange of money when they revolted against Uddhav Thackeray.

210.title: Ghaziabad boy dies of gunshot injuries; 2 suspects absconding
210.article_body: An 18-year-old boy died of gunshot injuries while he was out with his two friends in Ghaziabad on Saturday. The two friends of the deceased, Vansh, are absconding and the boy's family alleged that they were involved in the murder. The murder happened in Loni's Chirodi area when all three were out to make social media reels, police said.

211.title: 16 Indian sailors 'illegally detained' in Equatorial Guinea for over 80 days seek help
211.article_body: Around 16 Indian sailors are among 26 members of a ship's crew that have been in detention in Equatorial Guinea since August 2022. They said they have been "unlawfully detained" and issued a statement requesting help from the Indian government for their release and repatriation to India. Union Minister V Muraleedharan said efforts are being made to that end.

212.title: Telangana University students call for ‘Chalo Raj Bhavan’ protest against Guv
212.article_body: Telangana University students' Joint Action Committee (JAC) has called for a 'Chalo Raj Bhavan' protest in Hyderabad against Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan allegedly delaying approval of the Telangana Common Recruitment Board Bill. "Politics is being unnecessarily brought into policy matters," said the JAC. They also claimed the Centre was using the Governor to control the Telangana government.

213.title: Odisha policeman suspended for hitting woman in Puri temple
213.article_body: An Odisha Police Havildar was suspended for allegedly hitting a 65-year-old elderly woman with a cane stick inside Shree Jagannatha Temple in the state's Puri district. The woman, Madhuri Das, got into an argument with the Havildar, Prashant Dalai, before the latter hit on her head. Das was immediately taken to a hospital by other security personnel, police said.

214.title: 2 ex-Punjab Police officers get life term in 29-yr-old fake encounter case
214.article_body: Two former Punjab Police officers have been sentenced to life imprisonment in a 29-year-old fake encounter case that took place in the Tarn Taran district. The case pertains to 1993 when a resident of Uboke was shown as killed. The CBI had filed a case against the police officials in 1999.

215.title: Please get out: Kerala Governor to 2 journalists during press meet
215.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Monday barred two journalists from CPI(M)-backed Kairali TV and Jamaat-e-Islami-backed MediaOne TV from taking part in his interaction with the media in Kochi. "Please get out," Khan told the journalists. "They were lowering the dignity of the office despite repeated reminders from the Raj Bhavan," he added, while referring to the media organisations.

216.title: Vote for good 'malis' who will watch over your garden: Nadda in HP
216.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Monday urged Himachal Pradesh voters to vote for good 'malis' who will watch over their gardens, adding that they shouldn't vote on the basis of emotions. Nadda accused Congress of trying to confuse the voters, saying "those who have nothing to show always tend to confuse the voters and undermine the democratic process".

217.title: There will never be a sequel to 'English Vinglish': Adil Hussain
217.article_body: Adil Hussain, when asked if makers of 'English Vinglish' are planning to make its sequel, said, "I...saw Gauri Shinde's (director) statement that there will never be...sequel to [film]." "We were supposed to make...[sequel] even after Sridevi passed away...then somebody else passed away. The person who plays...[Sridevi's sister]...also passed away. Gauri probably took that as a sign," he added.

218.title: BBMP to send principals of schools with 100% pass results on tours
218.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will send principals of schools with 100% pass results in Secondary School Leaving Certificate and Higher Secondary exams on trips to Kashmir and Singapore. "This scheme will be arranged through the Corporate Social Responsibility initiative. If students score 100%, they too will be sent to Singapore," said BBMP Special Commissioner RP Manohar.

219.title: 18-yr-old kidnaps 14-yr-old girl in Mumbai, traced within hours
219.article_body: An 18-year-old youth was traced by police within hours after he allegedly kidnapped a 14-year-old girl from Mumbai's Bandra, an official said on Monday. A team of police and crime branch officials was formed to trace the girl after she went missing, the official said. Police analysed CCTV footage and found that a man had taken the girl with him.

220.title: Delhi man, sister-in-law pose as Yonex badminton kit dealers, held
220.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested and his sister-in-law was apprehended for allegedly cheating people on social media posing as authorised dealers of Yonex badminton kits, police said on Monday. A complainant said that he met someone on Facebook who presented himself as a Yonex dealer. He placed an order for a badminton kit and paid ₹3,03,500, police said.

221.title: Foreign national held with heroin worth ₹18 cr at Mumbai airport
221.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation seized 6 kg of heroin worth ₹18 crore in the international market from a foreign national at Mumbai airport. The accused has been arrested, reports said. In another incident, officials of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested three persons and seized narcotics worth ₹15 crore from the Mumbai international airport cargo on October 20.

222.title: IndiGo grounds about 30 aircraft due to 'supply chain disruptions'
222.article_body: IndiGo on Monday said that it grounded about 30 aircraft due to "supply chain disruptions". "While it is our...priority to deploy adequate capacity to serve our customers, we're actively engaged with...OEM (original equipment manufacturer) partners to work on mitigation measures that should ensure the continuity of our network," it said. IndiGo had 279 aircraft in its fleet as of September-end.

223.title: Lab-grown blood given to humans in a world-first clinical trial
223.article_body: Red blood cells grown in a laboratory have been transfused into humans in a world-first clinical trial. The manufactured blood cells were grown from stem cells from donors and then transfused into two people by UK researchers. If proven safe and effective, it could help in the treatment of people with sickle cell and rare blood types.

224.title: upGrad earmarks $30 mn for 10 global campuses in India, US, Singapore
224.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad announced that it'll invest $30 million to open 10 global campuses next year in US, India, Singapore and the Middle East. "This is a natural extension as we move to a very scaled blended offline and online model under our own upGrad brand," said Ronnie Screwvala, Co-founder, upGrad. Currently, upGrad has facilities in Mumbai, Hyderabad and Bengaluru.

225.title: Who will play whom in the Champions League round of 16?
225.article_body: Defending champions Real Madrid will face runners-up Liverpool in the Champions League 2022-23 round of 16. Meanwhile, Manchester City will play against RB Leipzig in the last 16. AC Milan will face Tottenham Hotspur, while Dortmund will face Chelsea. The first leg of round of 16 will take place in February 2023.

226.title: Pak PM spotted using phone as world leaders meet at COP27; video surfaces
226.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif was spotted checking his phone as the world leaders around him engaged in conversations at the COP27 climate change conference in Egypt. "While world leaders are busy discussing respective bilateral ties, Pakistan's Prime Minister is busy using his phone," Pakistan's political party PTI tweeted. "Every foreign visit is a new embarrassment for Pakistan," it added.

227.title: Was told 'Stop working, start cooking for Rajeev, he'll be happy': Charu
227.article_body: Actress Charu Asopa revealed that her estranged husband Rajeev Sen has a habit of blocking her on the phone. She added that his family is also annoyed with him. "So they would tell me to be mature. You stop working for 6 months, start cooking for him, he'll be...happy," Charu said, adding she "gave up on work...to keep him happy".

228.title: Local BJP leader shot dead by bike-borne men near his house in Bihar
228.article_body: A local BJP leader was shot dead by two bike-borne men near his house in Bihar's Katihar district on Monday, police said. The former Zilla Parishad member, Sanjeev Mishra, was taken to the hospital where he was declared brought dead. His supporters gathered outside police station and damaged several police vehicles parked there.

229.title: Love to see India-Pakistan final in T20 WC 2022: Shane Watson
229.article_body: Ex-Australian cricketer Shane Watson said that everyone would love to see India and Pakistan competing against each other in the final of the T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday. "I unfortunately missed that first (Super 12) game at the MCG...But from all reports, all the people that went along to that game said it was something very special," Watson said.

230.title: Murugha Mutt seer drugged, abused minor girls of choice in room: Report
230.article_body: Karnataka's Sri Murugha Mutt chief pontiff Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru allegedly drugged minor girls before abusing them, a police investigation has revealed. The accused seer asked another accused to send a minor girl of his choice to his private room, where he gave them chocolate laced with drugs, following which he abused and threatened them, reports said.

231.title: Philippines prisons chief ordered Oct killing of journalist: Police
231.article_body: Police in the Philippines on Monday accused Gerald Bantag, the chief of the country's prisons department, of ordering the killing of radio journalist Percival Mabasa who was shot dead on October 3. A complaint has been filed against Bantag and his deputy, Ricardo Zulueta. Bantag allegedly ordered the killing as Mabasa continued to expose issues linked to him.

232.title: 10,583 flat owners get tax rebate of ₹55 lakh for green projects in PCMC
232.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) Assistant Municipal Commissioner Nilesh Deshmukh has said that 10,583 flat owners have received a 5-10% tax rebate for the implementation of green projects. He said, "42 [societies]...have been implementing sewage treatment and zero waste projects." "These societies have 10,583 flats and all the flat owners have received a rebate of ₹55 lakh," he said.

233.title: Rethink age of consent under POCSO Act: Karnataka High Court to Law Commission of India
233.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has directed the Law Commission of India to reconsider the age of consent in Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. "The aspect of consent even by a girl of 16 years and above would've to be considered if there's indeed an offence under the IPC and/or POCSO Act," the court said.

234.title: 32 lakh weddings in India within 41 days to generate ₹3.75 lakh crore business: CAIT
234.article_body: Around 32 lakh weddings are expected to take place in India between November 4 and December 14, which will generate a business of ₹3.75 lakh crore for the country's traders, a Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) survey said. In Delhi alone, 3.5 lakh weddings will generate a business of ₹75,000 crore. The CAIT surveyed 4,302 traders in 35 cities.

235.title: BJP should seek votes in HP on report card and not manifesto: Cong
235.article_body: The Congress said the BJP should seek votes in Himachal Pradesh based on its report card and not its manifesto. It also challenged the ruling party to spell out the promises it has fulfilled instead of making fresh ones. Yesterday, BJP President JP Nadda released the party's manifesto promising Uniform Civil Code and 33% reservation for women in government jobs.

236.title: We'll check his stars: Supreme Court on compensation for astrologer who met with accident
236.article_body: While hearing a case on accident compensation of an astrologer, the Supreme Court said that it is surprised that an astrologer had an accident. "We will check his stars," the court said. The identity of the astrologer and specific case details are not yet known. "Court is the biggest astrologer of everyone's stars," a Twitter user joked.

237.title: 'Adipurush' makers to spend additional ₹100 crore to improve VFX: Report
237.article_body: 'Adipurush' makers will reportedly spend an extra ₹100 crore to improve the VFX of the film. This comes after the release date of 'Adipurush', which is reportedly made on the budget of ₹450-500 crore, has been postponed to June 16, 2023. Several users on Twitter trolled the teaser of the film over Saif Ali Khan's look and the film's VFX.

238.title: Right-wing group asks B'luru Police to revoke permission for Vir Das' show
238.article_body: A right-wing group, Janajagruthi Vedike, has urged Bengaluru Police to cancel permission given to comedian Vir Das to hold his show in the city. A letter submitted at the Vyalikaval Police Station by Mohan Gowda, state spokesperson of the outfit, stated that Das passed derogatory comments about women and PM Narendra Modi, which "denigrated the nation".

239.title: Raj businessman suffers cardiac arrest while reading newspaper, video surfaces
239.article_body: A video showing a 61-year-old man in Rajasthan suffering a cardiac arrest while reading a newspaper at a clinic has gone viral. The deceased, a garment businessman, visited a clinic for a toothache he developed. The deceased can be seen sitting in the waiting room before collapsing, following which a woman sitting at the reception rushed to help him.

240.title: Dad has 3 daughters, this is deja vu for him: Mahesh's son on Alia's baby
240.article_body: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt's son Rahul Bhatt, in an interview, talked about how his father is excited about Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's daughter. "He couldn't wait for...baby's arrival," Rahul said, adding, "What...happened is...he has had three daughters (Pooja, Shaheen and Alia)...so it's...deja vu of sorts for him. He's comparing this to the time when his first daughter, Pooja was born."

241.title: 'Zeher Khurani' gang robs people using sleeping pills in Delhi, 3 held
241.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested three members of the 'Zeher Khurani' gang, which is known for robbing people after sedating them with sleeping pills. According to the police, the gang would make people eat sweets mixed with powdered sleeping pills and would rob them after they would get unconscious. The arrested persons have been identified as Kamal Singh, Pawan and Gourav.

242.title: SC acquits 3 rape and murder convicts called 'predators' by Delhi HC
242.article_body: Supreme Court has acquitted three convicts, Ravi Kumar, Rahul and Vinod, sentenced to death after being held guilty of raping and killing a 19-year-old woman in 2012. Delhi High Court also confirmed the punishment, saying they were "predators" moving on streets looking for prey. The victim's body was found with injuries due to assault with car tools and earthen pots.

243.title: Sridevi was sick, but still shot 'Kate Nahin...' song: Boney on 'Mr India'
243.article_body: Filmmaker Boney Kapoor recalled that actress Sridevi continued to shoot for Mr India's 'Kate Nahin' song even when she was sick. "Sri fell sick during the shoot for 2-3 days, but still shot the song with a temperature," he shared. Boney said the song took 21 days to shoot, while the complete film was shot in around 380 days.

244.title: Samantha never revealed she had Myositis, felt sad: 'Yashoda' actor
244.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu's 'Yashoda' co-star Unni Mukundan said that he wasn't aware of the actress' health condition. He said Samantha "never mentioned" that she was diagnosed with Myositis. "I didn't know it...I felt sad after seeing Samantha's post. She'll fight it and come back in good health," the actor added. He described Samantha as a "very dedicated and hardworking" actress.

245.title: Anusha Dandekar's startup BrownSkin Beauty raises ₹3.5 crore: Report
245.article_body: Direct-to-consumer skincare startup BrownSkin Beauty has reportedly raised ₹3.5 crore in seed funding from Sequoia Capital India at an undisclosed valuation. The brand, which caters products exclusively to Indian skin tones, was founded by VJ, actor and television host Anusha Dandekar and Gaurav Kumar. The report further added that the fundraise talks had been on since August.

246.title: Shruti Haasan shares childhood pic of father Kamal Haasan on his b'day
246.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan, taking to her Instagram Stories on Monday, shared a childhood picture of her father, Kamal Haasan, to wish him on his birthday. "Happy birthday Bapuji (father)," she wrote. Actor Prakash Raj also shared a post on Kamal's birthday. "Thank you for always inspiring us...wish you the best on your day...our dearest Kamal Haasan," he wrote.

247.title: AAP and BJP are same team: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar
247.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls, Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar criticised AAP, BJP and claimed that both are the same team, with one following the other. "When [PM] Modi and Kejriwal have the same dreams, what is the ideological difference between them? Amidst the politics of hate...and polarisation, you want to do your politics by remaining [silent]," said Kumar.

248.title: Cong doesn’t care for country’s security, people’s sentiments: UP CM
248.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said Congress couldn’t have taken steps such as surgical strike, construction of Ram temple or abrogation of Article 370 because it doesn’t care for country’s security or people's sentiments. "Congress is a party of a family...What’s the point in voting for such party?" CM Yogi said while addressing a public meeting in Himachal Pradesh.

249.title: Mumbai local trains delayed on suburban line due to technical snag
249.article_body: Trains on the Western Railway's suburban section are reportedly running late by at least 15-20 minutes. The delay is due to signal failure reported between Vaitarna and Virar on UP fast line earlier this morning. However, the issue was resolved by 6.20 am, according to officials. Meanwhile, some passengers claimed that few locals have been cancelled on the suburban section.

250.title: UP police lathi-charge women protesting over Ambedkar statue vandalism; video surfaces
250.article_body: Five women and four police personnel were injured after a clash broke out between the police and women who were protesting over the vandalism of a BR Ambedkar statue in Uttar Pradesh's Ambedkar Nagar. A purported video of the incident which shows police personnel lathi-charging women has surfaced online. The police claimed that people pelted stones at them.

251.title: Instagram facing 'fair amount of urgency' in trying to make Reels work: Head
251.article_body: Instagram is facing a 'fair amount of urgency' in trying to make Reels work, Head Adam Mosseri told Bloomberg. Instagram aims to drive more revenue through Reels with the help of creators, advertisers and a better algorithm. "I'm trying to balance that urgency with making sure we don't make any mistakes by pushing too hard or too fast," Mosseri said.

252.title: Twitter Co-founder points out 'tracking additions' in tweets, people correct him
252.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey called the "tracking additions" while sharing a tweet "a step backwards", adding that nothing is needed after the question mark. Soon after his tweet, several Twitter users corrected him saying that it has been like this for months, with one tweeting, "Not a new addition." Dorsey later tweeted "apologies" to a Twitter user who corrected him.

253.title: Suspected drunk girls punch and kick another girl in MP's Indore; video viral
253.article_body: A video has gone viral on the internet that shows four girls, who are suspected to be drunk, punching and kicking another girl on a busy road in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. In the video, the accused were seen pulling the woman's hair and beating her as bystanders watched. The victim told the police that she was beaten without any reason.

254.title: Demonetisation was colossal failure which crippled Indian economy: KTR
254.article_body: Demonetisation was a colossal failure which crippled the growing Indian economy, Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao said on Monday. "This half-baked idea led to eight consecutive quarters of slowdown, subsequently landing in lockdown in 2020 serving a body blow to vibrant economy," KTR tweeted. Meanwhile, Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge said the Prime Minister is yet to acknowledge this "epic failure".

255.title: Auto driver smashes head of man who cut off his tongue in Bengaluru
255.article_body: An auto driver allegedly killed a 38-year-old man by smashing his head with a stone in Bengaluru. According to police, the deceased had hired the accused's auto last year. He and his friends later had an altercation with the accused, following which they cut off his tongue. The accused wanted to take revenge and therefore, he killed him.

256.title: 2 male cheetahs flown from Namibia kill their 1st prey on Indian soil
256.article_body: Two male cheetah siblings, who were flown from Namibia along with six other cheetahs, killed their first prey on Indian soil within 24 hours of their release from quarantine at Kuno National Park. The cheetahs hunted down a cheetal (spotted deer), according to forest department officials. "Cheetahs making their first kill within 24 hours is beyond expectation," an official said.

257.title: What's the point of run-a-ball 30 if you can't finish?: Afridi on Babar
257.article_body: Talking about Babar Azam, ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said, "Babar needs to listen to suggestions...He should...[bat at] number three...His batting position isn't set in stone." "What's the point of scoring a run-a-ball 30...if you can't finish the game having used up that many deliveries?" added Afridi. Babar scored 25(33) in Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh.

258.title: India wasn’t recognised during Cong’s rule, PM took it forward: Nadda
258.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Monday said India wasn’t recognised in the world during the Congress’ rule but PM Narendra Modi has put India on the world map and taken it forward in the last eight years. While addressing a public meeting in Himachal Pradesh’s Rampur, Nadda said, "India is no more a taker, it has become a giver."

259.title: 2 die while cleaning sewage chamber in Pune
259.article_body: Pune Rural Police said two sanitation workers died of suspected suffocation while cleaning a sewage chamber. One worker slipped and fell into the sewage chamber while inserting the suction pipe, while the other fainted and fell while trying to rescue him, an inspector said. A case is being registered against a company contracted for sewage cleaning work.

260.title: Manish Sisodia's aide Dinesh Arora to be govt's witness in Delhi liquor policy case
260.article_body: Dinesh Arora, aide of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, will become government's witness in the Delhi liquor policy case. The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Monday moved a plea in a Delhi Court to make Arora a witness in the case. The court had granted him anticipatory bail after CBI didn't oppose the bail plea in the case.

261.title: What did the dissenting judges say as SC upheld 10% EWS quota in a 3:2 verdict?
261.article_body: CJI UU Lalit and Justice S Ravindra Bhat on Monday held that 10% EWS quota was "unconstitutional" as the other three justices upheld its validity. Justice Bhat said, "By excluding the poor among SC/ST/OBC from economically backward classes, the amendment practices constitutionally prohibited forms of discrimination." He added that this amendment undermined the fabric of social justice.

262.title: Devegowda urges PM to erect Kempegowda's bronze statue at Parliament
262.article_body: Former PM HD Devegowda has urged Prime Minister Modi to erect a bronze statue of Kempegowda on the premises of the Parliament building in Delhi. In a letter to the PM, he said, "Kempegowda established...Bangalore in the 16th century and the seeds that he sowed centuries ago have today flowered into a globally renowned metropolis that we are...proud of."

263.title: Man booked in Ludhiana for distributing sweets over Sudhir Suri’s death
263.article_body: A case was registered in Punjab's Ludhiana against a man who allegedly distributed sweets over the death of Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri, officials said. Suri was shot dead in Amritsar on Friday. Police lodged an FIR against the man after a purported video of him distributing sweets over Suri’s death was shared on social media.

264.title: Which companies have paused their ads on Twitter after Musk's takeover?
264.article_body: Following Elon Musk’s takeover of Twitter and the subsequent changes at the firm, several companies paused their ads on the platform. These companies include General Motors, Audi, Volkswagen Group, Pfizer, Carlsberg Group, Mondelez International and General Mills, which manufactures Häagen-Dazs and Cheerios. Advertising agency Interpublic Group also advised its clients to suspend ads on Twitter.

265.title: 3 Pune areas report poor air quality, city coldest in Maha at 12.7°C
265.article_body: In Pune, Shivajinagar, Hadapsar and Bhosari reported poor air quality on Sunday evening, according to System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). The India Meteorological Department said that Pune was the coldest place in Maharashtra at 12.7°C on Sunday night. SAFAR added that Pune's overall AQI is moderate and likely to remain the same till November 8.

266.title: Satyamev Jayate: Jharkhand CM after SC allows his appeal against HC order
266.article_body: Reacting to Supreme Court's decision allowing his plea challenging Jharkhand High Court's order against him in the illegal mining case, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said, "Satyamev Jayate". He shared the news on his official Twitter handle. Earlier, the Supreme Court had restrained High Court from proceeding with the PILs seeking a probe against Soren in the mining lease issue.

267.title: Added some bits in Shiva & Isha's story for Brahmastra's OTT version: Ayan
267.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji said that he and music composer Pritam "refined the sound" of 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' and "added a few nips and tucks" to the film ahead of its OTT premiere. "I added some bits in Shiva and Isha's love story...subtle stuff. I believe that it will make the journey of the film a little smoother," he added.

268.title: Oppn leaders criticise demonetisation move, call it 'failure', 'jumla'
268.article_body: Ahead of the sixth anniversary of the demonetisation exercise, Opposition leaders criticised the move, calling it a "failure" and "jumla". Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said, "PM is yet to acknowledge...epic failure that led to fall of economy." Congress spokesperson Shama Mohamed said, "Note bandi was nothing but a jumla." Meanwhile, TRS leader KTR called the move a "colossal failure".

269.title: No external injuries on 9-yr-old girl who died in B'luru school: Report
269.article_body: A preliminary forensic report on the death of a nine-year-old student at a school in Bengaluru has revealed no signs of external injuries on the girl's body, police sources said. The deceased girl collapsed in her school on Friday, following which her father, in a complaint, alleged that she might've died while students were being punished at the school.

270.title: 11-year-old boy dies after falling into open drain in Faridabad
270.article_body: An 11-year-old boy died after allegedly falling into an open drain in Faridabad on Saturday. The incident took place when the boy, Kunal, had gone to buy some items from a shop near his house, police said. The Municipal Corporation of Faridabad's sub-divisional officer and area joint engineer, along with the local councillor, have been booked for their alleged negligence.

271.title: Migrant rescue ship Humanity 1 refuses to leave Italian port
271.article_body: Migrant rescue ship Humanity 1 which was allowed to dock at Italy's Catania port on Sunday refused to leave the port later in the day. The captain refused Italian orders after authorities did not let the last remaining 35 migrants aboard the ship disembark. Authorities allowed 144 migrants, including 100 unaccompanied minors and people with medical emergencies, to get off.

272.title: Didn't go anywhere: Vijay Deverakonda on 'comeback' after 'Liger'
272.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda has said that fans have come up to him asking him to make a comeback after the failure of his recent film 'Liger'. "Wherever I go, fans keep saying, anna (brother), you have to give a comeback. I wanted to tell you, I didn't go anywhere," he stated. The actor will next feature in 'Kushi'.

273.title: Bombarding Suryakumar with short balls is only way to dismiss him: Waqar
273.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis said "bombarding" Suryakumar Yadav with short deliveries is the best as well as the only way to dismiss him in T20s. "It's very difficult to bowl [to] him," added Waqar. Discussing Suryakumar's 61* off 25 balls in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Zimbabwe, ex-Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram stated, "Suryakumar has come from...[another] planet."

274.title: Sukesh's letter exposes AAP, a party of 'ugai, thagai & lutai': BJP
274.article_body: BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla on Monday shared a copy of jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar's letter to Delhi LG VK Saxena and called AAP a party of "ugai, thagai, lutai" (corruption, cheating and looting). BJP leader Meenakashi Lekhi on Sunday demanded AAP's Satyendar Jain be shifted to another prison, accusing Jain of running an extortion racket from jail.

275.title: 4 doctors booked for negligence after UK citizen dies in Gurugram
275.article_body: The Gurugram Police booked four doctors of a private hospital for medical negligence in connection with the death of a 22-year-old citizen of the United Kingdom in May. According to reports, he received serious injuries while parking his car. Based on the report of the medical negligence board, an FIR was registered at the Sector 50 police station on Friday.

276.title: I'd go with Pant over Karthik for T20 WC semi-final vs Eng: Shastri
276.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said he would pick Rishabh Pant over Dinesh Karthik in India's lineup for the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England. "Pant recently won a match on his [own] against England...You need a left-hander...who can...win you [the] game in the back overs," added Shastri. Shastri further termed Pant's X-factor as a reason behind his opinion.

277.title: No 'maai ka laal' can say HP CM Jairam Thakur's govt is corrupt: Rajnath
277.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh praised Himachal CM Jairam Thakur for his governance. "I can guarantee, no 'maai ka laal' in Himachal or across the country can say that there's even a blip of corruption in...Jairam Thakur's governance," Singh said. "He should be given another chance to make his government in Himachal," Singh added.

278.title: UP man kills sister, lover; goes to police station to confess
278.article_body: A woman and her lover were allegedly killed by her brother in UP's Farrukhabad and their bodies were dumped in a drain, the police said. The matter came to light on Sunday after the accused, Neetu, went to the city police station and confessed to having killed his sister Shivani (23) and her lover Ramkaran (25), the police added.

279.title: Ex-S Korean Prez to give up dogs gifted by N Korea's Kim Jong-un
279.article_body: Former South Korean President Moon Jae-in said on Monday that he plans to give up the dogs gifted by North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, which are legally categorised as state property. Moon's office claimed that the country's Presidential office seemed "negative" about entrusting the dogs to Moon. "If that's the case, we can be cool about it," Moon's office said.

280.title: Tirupati temple trust richer than Wipro, Nestlé India with ₹2.5 lakh crore net worth
280.article_body: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams' (TTD) has a net worth of nearly ₹2.5 lakh crore, which is more than the market capitalisation of IT firm Wipro (₹2.14 lakh crore), Nestlé India (₹1.97 lakh crore), and state-owned ONGC (₹1.74 lakh crore). The TTD revealed its assets include 10.25 tonnes of gold deposits, 2.5 tonnes of gold jewellery and 960 properties among others.

281.title: Prabhas was the first celebrity to post about 'Kantara': Sapthami
281.article_body: Actress Sapthami Gowda, who featured in 'Kantara', said that Prabhas was the first celebrity to post about the film on social media and added that it was special. "I watched 'Baahubali: The Beginning' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' when I was younger...I'm a fan. So that was some validation for me," she added. Prabhas had praised the film on Instagram.

282.title: You're very quickly getting there dude: ABD on Suryakumar calling him the only 360° player
282.article_body: On being called 'Mr 360°' by Irfan Pathan, Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav, while referring to AB de Villiers, said, "There is only one 360° player in the world, and I will try to play like him." Reacting to Suryakumar's comment, AB de Villiers tweeted, "You're very quickly getting there dude, and even more! Well played [against Zimbabwe]."

283.title: PM yet to acknowledge this 'epic failure': Kharge on demonetisation move
283.article_body: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge criticised PM Narendra Modi-led government’s 2016 demonetisation move, saying PM is yet to acknowledge this "epic failure" that led to the "fall of economy". "Demonetisation was promised to free the country of black money but it destroyed businesses and ruined jobs," Kharge tweeted. "Cash available in public is 72% higher than that in 2016," he added.

284.title: Gujarat HC issues notice to state govt over Morbi bridge collapse
284.article_body: The Gujarat High Court on Monday took suo motu cognisance of the Morbi suspension bridge collapse, which left over 130 people dead and issued notices to the state government and other authorities. The court also sought a report on the matter by November 14. So far, at least nine people have been arrested in connection with the incident.

285.title: John Abraham was our only choice to play villain: 'Pathaan' director
285.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand said that John Abraham was his "first and only choice" to play the antagonist in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'Pathaan'. Calling John a "perfect" fit to play the film's villain, Siddharth said, "We've made their rivalry look deliciously edge of the seat. It will be one hell of a thrilling showdown." 'Pathaan' also stars Deepika Padukone.

286.title: Indian stock market has shown phenomenal resilience: Jefferies' Wood
286.article_body: Global head of equity strategy at Jefferies, Chris Wood, has said that the Indian stock market has shown phenomenal resilience amid global headwinds and a significant monetary tightening cycle by the central bank. "[The] Indian stock market in the face of a very bearish global environment tells you how good the well-positioned interiors domestically," Wood said.

287.title: What is the law on 10% EWS reservations upheld by the Supreme Court today?
287.article_body: The 103rd Amendment of 2019 inserted Articles 15(6) and 16(6) in the Constitution to provide 10% EWS reservation to persons who aren't covered under the SC, ST and OBC reservations. The rationale was that the amendment could empower state governments to provide reservation on the basis of economic backwardness – determined by criteria like land size owned, annual income etc.

288.title: Palak, Mithoon host wedding reception; Sonu Nigam, Rupali Ganguly attend
288.article_body: Newlywed couple Palak Muchhal and Mithoon hosted a wedding reception on Sunday in Mumbai. Celebrities including Sonu Nigam, Rupali Ganguly, Smriti Mandhana, Aditya Narayan, Armaan Malik and Salim Merchant were spotted at the reception. Palak, who has sung for films like 'Ek Tha Tiger' and 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo', tied the knot with music composer Mithoon on Sunday.

289.title: Samantha promotes 'Yashoda' after Myositis diagnosis, shares pics
289.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu has returned to work "for a day" to promote her upcoming film 'Yashoda'. The actress had recently opened up about being diagnosed with autoimmune condition Myositis. Sharing pictures of herself on Instagram, Samantha said she borrowed "good friend" and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru's advice that "no matter what the day is like and how sh***y things are...show up".

290.title: Career in Journalism doesn't require specific qualification: Delhi HC
290.article_body: Delhi High Court has dismissed an appeal challenging the appointment of Dr Sanjay Dwivedi as the Director General (DG) of the Indian Institute of Mass Communication (IIMC). The court said, "[Pursuing] a career in journalism doesn't require possessing a specific qualification." Dwivedi's appointment was challenged on the ground that it didn't satisfy the minimum eligibility criteria for the post.

291.title: 48-yr-old man held for stealing ATM cards, withdrawing money; 21 cards found
291.article_body: A 48-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stealing people's ATM cards and withdrawing money from their accounts in Maharashtra's Palghar. The police have recovered 21 ATM cards and a motorcycle from his possession, senior inspector Pramod Bhadak said. He was caught following inspection of CCTV footage.

292.title: Jahangirpuri violence accused arrested again for trying to jeopardise peace
292.article_body: The Delhi Police arrested the alleged mastermind of Jahangirpuri violence, Ansar, once again for trying to create tension by taking out a procession in the area. Along with him, the police apprehended three others. The area witnessed violent clashes, including stone pelting, arson and firing between two communities during a Hanuman Jayanti procession on April 16.

293.title: 2 teenagers killed after race car runs off road in Belgium
293.article_body: Two teenage spectators were killed on Sunday after being hit by a race car that veered off the road during the Rallye du Condroz event in Belgium, local authorities said. An alcohol test on the driver and the co-driver came back negative. It is being investigated if or not the teenagers were in an area authorized for public access.

294.title: US teenager who killed her rapist escapes from probation centre
294.article_body: An 18-year-old girl, who'd pled guilty to killing a man she said raped her, has escaped from a women's centre in US' Iowa where she was serving her probation sentence, authorities said. According to probation violation report, the teenager was seen walking out of the centre and her GPS monitor was cut off. The teenager is a sex trafficking victim.

295.title: 6-month-old abused stray dog adopted by a family in Mumbai
295.article_body: A six-month-old stray dog named Rani, who was sodomised by a food delivery person in October, was adopted by a family in Mumbai. After mid-day reported the incident, more than a dozen residents came forward to adopt Rani and finally Prabhadevi residents Gokul Mundhra and his partner Sonal adopted her. The adoption was facilitated by NGO Bombay Animal Rights.

296.title: 'Brahmastra 2' makers approach Vijay Deverakonda to play Dev: Report
296.article_body: 'Brahmastra Part Two: Dev' makers have reportedly approached Vijay Deverakonda to play Dev in the Ayan Mukerji directorial. "Karan is looking at roping in Vijay," a source informed Bollywood Hungama. Earlier, some reports suggested that 'KGF' actor Yash was also approached to play Dev in the sequel, but Karan Johar refuted the claims and called the reports "rubbish".

297.title: Allu Arjun, Rashmika's 'Pushpa: The Rise' to release in Russia: Report
297.article_body: Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Pushpa: The Rise' will reportedly release in Russia in December. "Allu is currently occupied with other work commitments and depending on his schedule, the makers will lock the release date," a source was quoted as saying. According to the report, Allu Arjun will fly to Russia to promote the film.

298.title: AIADMK led alliance will win all 40 LS seats in TN, Puducherry: Palaniswami
298.article_body: AIADMK Interim General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami claimed that the party led alliance will win all 40 Lok Sabha seats in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry in 2024. "Hindi was imposed in Tamil Nadu [when Congress was in Centre]. So...being in alliance with Congress, DMK doesn’t have the moral right to speak about Hindi imposition," said Palaniswami.

299.title: Kathy Griffin uses late mother's account after her Twitter suspension, tweets '#FreeKathy’
299.article_body: Comedian Kathy Griffin is now using her late mother's Twitter profile as her account was suspended on the platform for impersonating Elon Musk. Commenting on one of Musk's tweets about her account suspension, Kathy wrote, "Please do a better job running this company." In another tweet from her mother's account, she told Musk, "I'm back from the grave to say...#FreeKathy"

300.title: Did 'Mili' because father Boney started crying on phone: Janhvi Kapoor
300.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor, speaking about 'Mili', has revealed that she was not sure if she should be a part of another remake after she featured in 'Good Luck Jerry'. "Father (Boney Kapoor) got...emotional about 'Mili', he said...'If you don't do the film I will make it, I need to tell this story'. He started crying on the phone," she added.

301.title: Teams thought they'd got rid of us but now they can't: Pak mentor Hayden
301.article_body: Pakistan mentor Matthew Hayden gave a speech in the dressing room after Pakistan qualified for the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals following a win against Bangladesh. "Teams thought...they'd got rid of us...[but now they can't]...There'll be no one...[who'd] want to face us," said Hayden. "We are here and it's powerful because no one wants to see us here," he added.

302.title: Woman burned alive on suspicion of witchcraft in Bihar, 14 arrested
302.article_body: Fourteen people were arrested on Sunday for allegedly burning a 45-year-old woman alive at her home on suspicion of practising witchcraft in Bihar’s Gaya, police said. Furthermore, the police said that a month ago, a man died after a prolonged illness and family of the deceased man accused the woman of witchcraft, after which both families were at loggerheads.

303.title: Twitter left with a dozen employees in India after firing 90% staff: Report
303.article_body: Twitter has fired more than 90% of its staff in India as part of the global workforce reductions ordered by its new owner Elon Musk, Bloomberg reported. Twitter now employs only about a dozen employees in India, as opposed to over 200 employees previously, the report said. The layoffs affected about 70% of Twitter's engineering and product staff in India.

304.title: We know Pakistan are dangerous: NZ's Tim Southee ahead of WC semi-final
304.article_body: Ahead of their T20 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan on Wednesday, New Zealand's Tim Southee has termed the Babar Azam-led side as a "massive threat", stating that they'll have to be on top of their game to win the match. "Hopefully, we can continue the way that we've been playing," he added. India will play the second semi-final against England.

305.title: Mumbai's Gokhale Bridge closed for traffic from today
305.article_body: The Gokhale Bridge, which links Andheri East and West, will be closed for traffic from today for at least two years as BMC will start reconstruction work on the bridge. The traffic police have suggested six alternative routes for commuters. BMC decided to shut the bridge as it found the structure to be unsafe during a structural audit in September.

306.title: Who are the five people in Elon Musk's core team at Twitter?
306.article_body: Elon Musk has five people in his core team at Twitter to help him make changes to the platform. The team includes Jared Birchall, the head of the family office that manages Musk's assets, Jason Calacanis, an entrepreneur who's close to Musk, and Indian-origin engineer Sriram Krishnan. High-profile celebrity lawyer Alex Spiro and investor David Sacks are also helping Musk.

307.title: Mother, son concoct fake kidnapping story to frame neighbour in Faridabad
307.article_body: The Faridabad Police on Sunday booked a mother-son duo for allegedly concocting a kidnapping story to frame their neighbour on false charges to take revenge for a recent fight between them. The woman, in her complaint, said that three-four men kidnapped her son, alleging that she could identify one of the accused who threatened to kill him.

308.title: Tanker driver arrested for releasing chemical into river in Thane
308.article_body: A 32-year-old tanker driver was arrested for allegedly releasing a hazardous chemical solution into the Waldhuni river in Thane. The incident took place on Saturday when the accused polluted the river by releasing the toxic chemical into it from the tanker, police said. Accused has been booked under relevant provisions of the Indian Penal Code and the Environment (Protection) Act.

309.title: 12-year-old boy dies after cupboard falls on his head in Mumbai
309.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died due to severe head injuries after a cupboard fell on his head in Mumbai on Saturday. The boy was sleeping when a wooden cupboard attached to a wall fell on another cupboard, which came crashing on him. He was taken to JJ Hospital, however, he died during treatment. Meanwhile, police have registered an accidental death report.

310.title: Australia played very un-Australian cricket in T20 WC: Michael Clarke
310.article_body: Former Australian captain Michael Clarke has said that the Aaron Finch-led side played very "un-Australian" cricket in the T20 World Cup. "We picked an aggressive 11 in this World Cup squad yet played so defensively," stated Clarke. "Australia had to walk out there against Afghanistan and say, 'We're going to make 200 and bowl you out for 100'," he added.

311.title: 1,000 protesters march in Ghana demanding Prez Nana's resignation
311.article_body: Over 1,000 protesters marched in Ghana's capital city of Accra seeking the resignation of President Nana Akufo-Addo as the country faces an economic crisis. The protesters, who were wearing red coloured clothes, waved placards and raised slogans like, 'Akufo-Addo must go'. "High fuel price increments are killing the people of Ghana," a protester said.

312.title: Allu Arjun shares Pushpa 2's update, says it'll be 'Asalu Thaggedhe Le'
312.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun recently shared an update on 'Pushpa: The Rule'. Hinting that the sequel will be much better than the 2021 release, the actor said that he's excited for the Sukumar directorial. "If it was 'Thaggedhe Le' in 'Pushpa 1', it'll be 'Asalu Thaggedhe Le' in 'Pushpa 2'," he added. For the unversed, 'Thaggedhe Le' is Pushpa's popular dialogue.

313.title: 38-year-old man on way back home killed as bike hits 2-wheeler in Pune
313.article_body: A 38-year-old man was killed and his daughter was injured after a speeding motorcycle hit their two-wheeler in Pune. The deceased's wife lodged a complaint in the case. The father-daughter duo was on their way back home when the incident took place, police said. The motorcycle rider has been booked, police added.

314.title: Locals vandalise liquor den in Rajkot following cases of harassment
314.article_body: A  liquor den was attacked by residents on Sunday night following cases of harassment caused due to drunken men in Gujarat's Rajkot. The people had been complaining for a long time and decided to act on their own when no concrete action was taken. The crowd eventually dispersed after a police officer promised action against the bootlegger.

315.title: Man tries to kill neighbour disguised as woman in Mumbai, arrested
315.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 34-year-old man, Kamlesh Hatim, for allegedly trying to kill his 59-year-old neighbour while disguised as a woman. "The victim had given a loan of about ₹5 lakh to the accused...She...was constantly demanding the amount," said an official. The victim informed the police that Hatim was the person who had attacked her while wearing a saree.

316.title: Virat Kohli wins ICC Men's Player of the Month award for the first time ever
316.article_body: India batter Virat Kohli has been named the ICC Men's Player of the Month for October. This is the first time that the 34-year-old has bagged the monthly award. Kohli scored 205 runs in T20I cricket in October at an average of 205 and a strike-rate of 150.73. Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza and South Africa's David Miller were the other nominees.

317.title: 2 people make 85-yr-old give jewellery worth ₹2 lakh on pretext of gifting saree
317.article_body: An 85-year-old woman lost gold jewellery worth around ₹2 lakh after two people lured her into taking it off and giving it to them under the pretext of gifting her saree and cash in Pune. The accused told her that his employer was blessed with a child and that they were gifting sarees and cash to elderly women.

318.title: I'll be the coolest grandfather in town: Mahesh Bhatt on Alia's baby
318.article_body: Director Mahesh Bhatt said that he'll be the "coolest grandfather in town" to Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's baby girl, who was born on Sunday. "In the blink of an eye, a girl whom I carried in my arms, is now a mama," he added. Alia-Ranbir also shared a note in which they called themselves "blessed and obsessed" parents.

319.title: BBMP plans to fix nearly 3,000 km of roads in B'luru over next 5 months
319.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) plans to asphalt close to 3,000 km of roads in Bengaluru over the course of next five months, BBMP Chief Engineer BS Prahalad said. BBMP plans to asphalt 427 km of arterial roads in next 90 dry days, Prahalad added. We have asked ward engineers to submit the number of potholes identified, he said.

320.title: Match officials for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals announced
320.article_body: T20 World Cup 2022's first semi-final between New Zealand & Pakistan will be overseen by umpires Marais Erasmus and Richard Illingworth, third umpire Richard Kettleborough, fourth umpire Michael Gough and match referee Chris Broad. India-England semi will be officiated by umpires Kumar Dharmasena and Paul Reiffel, third umpire Chris Gaffaney, fourth umpire Rod Tucker and referee David Boon.

321.title: SL cricketer Gunathilaka suspended from all forms of cricket after rape charges in Australia
321.article_body: Sri Lanka Cricket has suspended batter Danushka Gunathilaka from all forms of cricket after he was arrested and charged with sexual assault of a woman in Australia amid T20 World Cup 2022. The cricket board will also provide all the required support to the Australian law enforcement authorities to carry out an impartial inquiry into the incident.

322.title: 14-year-old girl strangled to death by neighbour for rejecting his marriage proposal in UP
322.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly strangled to death by her neighbour after she rejected his marriage proposal in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar. The deceased had been missing from home since Saturday and was found dead in a sugarcane field on Sunday. The girl's father said that the accused had also threatened his family. The accused has been arrested.

323.title: Huge fire races up 35-storey tower near Burj Khalifa in Dubai, video surfaces
323.article_body: A huge fire broke out on Monday morning at a 35-storey high-rise building near the Burj Khalifa in Dubai. Videos showed flames engulfing the high-rise, part of a series of towers called 8 Boulevard Walk by Emaar, the state-backed developer in the emirate. The fire was extinguished later but black char marks could be seen stretching up the building.

324.title: Mumbai Police recovers unidentified body of 55-year-old man in Dharavi
324.article_body: The Mumbai Police recovered a decomposed body of a 55-year-old unidentified man trapped inside a drain in Dharavi, Mumbai. The investigation is underway and the cause of death is not yet known as the police didn't find any marks on the body. The police has sent the body to Sion Hospital for post-mortem and filed an Accidental Death Report (ADR).

325.title: Delhi's primary schools to reopen from Nov 9, offices running at full capacity: Minister
325.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Monday announced that the primary schools, which had been shut in view of the pollution situation in city, will reopen from November 9. He also said offices have started functioning at full capacity from today. Besides that, ban on construction work related to highways, roads, flyovers, overbridges, pipelines and power transmission has been lifted.

326.title: Imran Khan committing crime of treason: Pak Interior Minister
326.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah Khan while speaking to Geo News claimed that the country's former PM Imran Khan is "committing the crime of treason against the state". This comes as Imran announced that he'll resume his protest march. "Imran Khan only has one demand: he wants to be adopted by...institutions to make him sit on...PM's chair," Rana said.

327.title: World's tallest woman takes her 1st flight; airline removes 6 seats for her
327.article_body: The world’s tallest woman Rumeysa Gelgi recently took her first-ever trip on a plane after Turkish Airlines removed six seats and replaced them with a special stretcher for her 13-hour travel. Gelgi, who stands at 7 feet and 0.7 inches tall, had never previously taken a flight due to her Weaver syndrome, causing her to use a wheelchair for movement.

328.title: We condemn the way Twitter has sacked employees in India: IT Minister
328.article_body: Union Minister for Information Technology Ashwini Vaishnaw has said that he condemns the way Twitter has sacked employees in India. "[Twitter] should have given the employees a fair time for transition," the minister was quoted as saying by Business Standard. As per reports, Twitter laid off majority of its more than 200-member workforce in India across various departments on Friday.

329.title: GRAP stage-4 restrictions lifted in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves
329.article_body: The Centre lifted the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) stage-4 measures imposed in Delhi-NCR as the air quality in the region slightly improved. Ban on diesel vehicles, construction activities are among few of the restrictions that were imposed in the region as part of the GRAP stage-4 plan. However, restrictions under GRAP stages 1–3 will continue to remain in effect.

330.title: 62-year-old woman stabbed to death by son-in-law in Hyderabad
330.article_body: A 62-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death by her son-in-law in Hyderabad’s Old City on Sunday. His wife was purportedly residing at the victim's house. The incident occurred when the accused went to the victim's house. "He...pulled out knife he was carrying and stabbed the victim, causing serious bleeding that ultimately led to her death," a police official said.

331.title: Five arrested in Bengaluru for honey trapping man from Tamil Nadu
331.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested five people, including a woman, for allegedly honey trapping a man who had come from Tamil Nadu to meet the woman. The victim said that four men recorded their videos in a compromising position and threatened him. The accused allegedly took ₹50,000 and his Hyundai car. The accused further threatened him to pay another ₹60,000.

332.title: ICC names 8 best matches of T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage
332.article_body: ICC has named eight best matches of Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022. The ICC included Netherlands' win over South Africa and said, "What a game, what a result and what a moment!" India's last-ball win against Pakistan and their defeat against South Africa also features on the list. Zimbabwe's one-run win over Pakistan has also been included.

333.title: I won't ban Twitter account tracking my private jet: Elon Musk
333.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk has said that he will not ban the Twitter account tracking his private jet. Musk, who recently acquired Twitter for $44 billion, said the decision shows his "commitment to free speech" even though the account poses a "direct personal safety risk". Earlier, Musk had offered $5,000 to 20-year-old Jack Sweeney to shut down the account.

334.title: Arhaan wants to learn filmmaking, assisted Karan Johar: Arbaaz
334.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan shared that his son Arhaan Khan is interested in filmmaking and has assisted director Karan Johar on his film for 20-30 days. "He is now excited about being on my film now...he'll join me in the last stage of my film 'Patna Shukla'," he said. Arbaaz's 'Patna Shukla' will feature Raveena Tandon in the lead role.

335.title: Section 144 imposed around TSPSC exam centres in Hyderabad
335.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in areas around centres conducting Telangana State Public Service Commission (TSPSC) exams across Hyderabad. The curfew has been imposed from 6 am on November 7 to 6 am on November 8, the police said. Assembly of four or more people within 500 yards of the centres will be prohibited.

336.title: Singer Palak Muchhal marries music composer Mithoon Sharma, shares pics
336.article_body: Singer Palak Muchhal tied the knot with music composer Mithoon Sharma in Mumbai on Sunday. Singers Sonu Nigam and Kailash Kher, film producer Krishika Lulla, and television actors Rubina Dilaik and Abhinav Shukla were seen at Palak-Mithoon's wedding reception. The couple shared the wedding photos on Instagram with the caption, "And forever begins..."

337.title: Recent missile tests were practices to 'mercilessly' attack S Korea, US: N Korea
337.article_body: North Korea's military on Monday said that its recent series of missile tests were practices to "mercilessly" strike key South Korean and US targets like air bases and operation command systems. Notably, North Korea fired dozens of missiles and flew warplanes towards the sea last week, leading to evacuation alerts in some South Korean and Japanese areas.

338.title: Hundreds of fired Twitter staff on H-1B visa face risk of deportation: Report
338.article_body: Hundreds of Twitter employees who have been laid off after Elon Musk's takeover are H-1B visa holders, according to Forbes. H-1B visa is a non-immigrant work visa that allows US companies to employ foreign workers in specialty occupations. As per rules, these employees have a 60-day deadline to find a new job to maintain their immigration status or face deportation.

339.title: India, Pak shouldn't return after losing in semis, I want to see their final: Akhtar
339.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said he wants to see an India-Pakistan final in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "It shouldn't be that India come back after losing their semi-final against England and Pakistan are also returning in the next flight," he added. Pakistan qualified for the semi-finals after defeating Bangladesh. They'll face New Zealand on November 9.

340.title: Educational institutions shut in Assam's Diphu due to dengue outbreak
340.article_body: In the wake of a surge in cases of dengue, all schools and colleges in Assam's Diphu have been asked to remain shut until next week. In the last five days, 270 cases of dengue were detected in the Karbi Anglong district. "All preventive measures are being taken to combat the situation," a statement released by National Health Mission said.

341.title: Man arrested for abducting, trying to rape 8-yr-old girl in Indore
341.article_body: Shaharyar Mirza, a 50-year-old man, was arrested by police officials in Indore for allegedly abducting and attempting to rape an eight-year-old girl. Mirza took the girl to a deserted place and tried to rape her. A few locals observed the crime taking place and rescued the girl. A case was registered under various sections including abduction and POCSO Act.

342.title: SC allows Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren to challenge cases against him for illegal mining
342.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday allowed Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren to challenge cases against him for illegal mining. Soren had been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate on November 3 in a case linked to illegal mining in the state. After skipping the summon, he had said the probe agency should arrest him if he has committed a big crime.

343.title: 3 motorcycles belonging to cops set ablaze in Nagpur, probe on
343.article_body: Three motorcycles belonging to policemen were set on fire by unidentified miscreants in Nagpur. The policemen were on a patrol when the incident took place around 2 am on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. The fire was extinguished in half an hour after the fire department was informed. A case has been registered and an investigation is underway.

344.title: 52-year-old ragpicker dies after being hit by car in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar
344.article_body: A 52-year-old unidentified ragpicker died after he was allegedly hit by a car outside a liquor store in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar on Sunday. The car also hit two other people, Anu Gupta and Sushil Kumar, who escaped with injuries. "Some men were pushing each other in an inebriated state...[They] were in no condition to drive the vehicles," said a victim.

345.title: 3 men shoot Chandigarh liquor vend employee over beer payment, steal ₹1,000
345.article_body: Three unidentified men shot a liquor vend employee in New Chandigarh, allegedly over payment of beers. "The assailants shot Om Parkash after arguments and also took away ₹1000 cash. They closed the shutter of the liquor vend in a bid to lock the injured inside," police said. The incident took place between 9 to 10 pm on Friday night.

346.title: India reports 937 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 14,515
346.article_body: India reported 937 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 1,132 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India stand at 14,515. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,30,509, according to the ministry.

347.title: 32,000 kg packed marijuana seized in Spain in largest ever seizure
347.article_body: Spain's Civil Guard has said that about 32,000 kg of packed marijuana, with an estimated street value of about $63.74 million, has been seized and added that the seizure is the largest ever not only in the country but also internationally. The seizure was made following raids on farms and production plants. Nine men and 11 women were arrested.

348.title: Order CBI probe, anything can happen before AAP's truth is exposed: Sukesh to Delhi L-G
