348.article_body: Jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekar has written a letter to Delhi's Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena, requesting him to direct an urgent CBI investigation against AAP leaders including Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Sukesh wrote, "Allow me to file an FIR as the pressure is getting too much and any undue event may take place before the truth about AAP is exposed."

349.title: Officials who allowed film studios to operate illegally in Mumbai to be penalised
349.article_body: BMC officials who failed to take action against five film studios in Madh-Marve region for functioning beyond their licence period will be liable for punishment, according to a confidential report recently submitted to municipal chief. "The quantum of punishment will be decided by the inquiry department. It also depends on what approach the commissioner takes," a civic official said.

350.title: 49 foreign universities look to tie-up with Indian institutes: UGC Chairman
350.article_body: University Grants Commission (UGC) Chairman M Jagadesh Kumar said at least 49 overseas universities have expressed interest to collaborate with Indian universities academically. "UGC is proactively contacting these universities. Several universities are in process of preparing MoUs," Kumar added. "These processes involve discussions and approvals within university statutory bodies," he stated.

351.title: Hyderabad to get 6 double-decker AC electric buses in January 2023
351.article_body: Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority has started the procurement of six double-decker AC electric buses which will start plying in the city from January 2023. The buses will be acquired on two years and two lakh kilometre warranty and an annual maintenance contract for next five years. Moreover, the buses will be able to ply in the city for 12-14 hours.

352.title: 2 buses collide as driver fails to navigate blind turn in Maha, 20 injured
352.article_body: Two state transport buses collided on Jawhar-Silvassa Road in Maharashtra's Palghar district on Monday. Palghar Police said that 20 people were injured in the incident. Those who were injured have been admitted to the nearest hospital for treatment, police added. Officials said it appears that the driver of one of the buses was unable to navigate the blind turn.

353.title: SC upholds 10% EWS quota, says 'It doesn't violate basic structure of Constitution'
353.article_body: A five-judge Constitution bench of Supreme Court has upheld the validity of the Constitution's 103rd Amendment Act 2019, which provides for 10% economically weaker section (EWS) reservation amongst the general category in education and public employment. "The law doesn't violate basic structure or equality code for taking into account economic criterion," Justice Dinesh Maheshwari said.

354.title: Woman, daughter caught with drugs worth ₹2.5 crore in Ambala
354.article_body: A middle-aged woman and her daughter were among three people arrested in Ambala for carrying drugs worth ₹2.5 crore. The two women are drug peddlers and were travelling to Ambala from Delhi in a private car, police said. They have been booked under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act. The woman and her daughter hail from Ambala.

355.title: Fire breaks out at international shopping store in Noida, no casualties
355.article_body: A fire broke out in an international shopping store for Mushkin products in Noida on Monday. Seven fire tenders were present on the spot and the fire was doused off. No casualties have been reported so far, police said. According to Gautam Buddh Nagar police’s media cell, fire broke out at Mushkin International B-39, under Phase-2 police station limits.

356.title: Zomato VP of global growth Siddharth Jhawar quits
356.article_body: Zomato's Global Growth VP Siddharth Jhawar has announced that he has quit the firm. He will be joining Tiger Global-backed adtech unicorn Moloco where he will run the firm's India operations. Kamayani Sadhwani, a Director at Zomato-owned Blinkit, has taken over from Jhawar as the head of the firm's intercity food delivery service.

357.title: Thane educator gets message saying she got work from home job, loses ₹10 lakh
357.article_body: A 35-year-old Thane woman educator was cheated of ₹10,70,000 after she paid the sum as investment in a company. She received a message from the company saying she had been selected for work from home job and will be able to earn ₹8,000 per day. Reports said the incident happened on September 3 but complaint was filed on November 4.

358.title: Several verified celebrities on Twitter change their display names to 'Elon Musk'
358.article_body: After Elon Musk's takeover and amid the company's new blue tick plan, several verified celebrities on Twitter changed their display names to 'Elon Musk'. Comedian Kathy Griffin, actress Valerie Bertinelli, Chris Kluwe and actor Rich Sommer were among these people. Meanwhile, Musk said Twitter handles engaging in impersonation without clearly specifying "parody" will be "permanently suspended".

359.title: MP woman tries to forcefully marry female friend in Rajasthan, arrested
359.article_body: A woman from Madhya Pradesh was arrested after she created ruckus at her female friend's house in Rajasthan, demanding to marry her. According to reports, the two women met on social media a few years ago. The MP woman reportedly sought a physical relationship and threatened to leak their chats online if her demands were not accepted, the police said.

360.title: Which 12 teams have directly qualified for 20-team T20 World Cup 2024?
360.article_body: Twelve teams have directly qualified for 20-team men's T20 World Cup 2024. West Indies and USA have qualified as they will host the tournament. India, New Zealand, Pakistan, England, South Africa, Australia, Netherlands and Sri Lanka have qualified as they are the top eight teams in T20 World Cup 2022. Further, Bangladesh and Afghanistan have qualified due to their rankings.

361.title: Twitter to delay verification changes until after US midterm polls: Report
361.article_body: Twitter is delaying rollout of blue tick verification marks to subscribers of its new $7.99/month service until after US midterm elections, scheduled to be held on Tuesday, The New York Times reported. Twitter had rolled out the service on Saturday for selective iOS users. Twitter said the service's subscribers will receive fewer ads and get priority ranking for quality content.

362.title: Biden calls Afghanistan a 'godforsaken place'; Taliban responds
362.article_body: US President Joe Biden while addressing war veterans in San Diego said that he'd been to "every part" of Afghanistan and added, "It's a godforsaken place." Following this, Taliban spokesperson Zabihullah Mujahid reacted to Biden's remarks, saying, "Those making such remarks are doing so out of their frustration and envy for Afghanistan." US withdrew its troops from Afghanistan last year.

363.title: Don't drink & drive: B'luru Police to citizens ahead of T20 World Cup finals
363.article_body: Ahead of T20 World Cup final match scheduled for coming Sunday, the Bengaluru Police asked citizens not to drink and drive. Taking to Twitter, the police wrote, "The World Cup final is next Sunday. We repeat, it's next Sunday so DONOT drink & drive today. Or next Sunday. Or any day. Nope." Special screenings of matches are arranged across Bengaluru.

364.title: RSS trying to destabilise state government: CPI(M) Kerala secretary MV Govindan
364.article_body: CPI(M) Kerala secretary MV Govindan on Sunday alleged that the RSS was trying to destabilise their government in the state. "The government has sought legal opinion over the Governor sitting over various bills and his attempts to unseat a majority of vice-chancellors in the state," he added. "We will move to any extent to fight this uncertainty," Govindan further said.

365.title: Police bust racket involved in illegal sale of oxytocin hormone in Pune
365.article_body: The Pune City Police's Crime Branch busted an organised racket involved in the illegal sale of oxytocin hormone in the city and arrested five persons. "Its use in dairy animals has serious adverse effects on humans," an official press statement read. Police also seized around 290 boxes containing oxytocin vials and ampoules worth over ₹53 lakh in the illicit market.

366.title: If I were Bangladesh captain, I would've ensured players see psychologists: Akram
366.article_body: Talking about Bangladesh who were knocked out of T20 World Cup 2022 after their recent loss against Pakistan, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "Bangladesh...[should] blame themselves." "If I were the captain...or coach of Bangladesh...I...would've made sure...the players see psychologists," added Akram. "The Bangladesh players made up their minds to...[only] hit Shaheen Afridi," he stated.

367.title: Laptops, emails disconnected within 2 minutes: Fired Brainly staff on India shutdown
367.article_body: A fired Brainly employee has alleged that the edtech company didn't handle layoffs properly while letting go nearly all team members from its India team. "CEO comes on the call -- announces India shutdown and within 2 minutes Slack and emails shut off, laptops disconnected," the employee said. They also alleged that Brainly didn't offer severance pay to fired workers.

368.title: Won't appear before ED, will attend Congress worker's b'day: Shivakumar
368.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar has said that he will not appear before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday as he will be participating in "a party worker's birthday event". This comes after ED summoned Shivakumar and his brother in connection to the National Herald case. Previously, Shivakumar and his brother had appeared before the ED in October.

369.title: 300% growth in enrolment for Executive MBA program: SP Jain Global
369.article_body: The SP Jain Executive MBA is a global program which aims to transform managers into powerful leaders of tomorrow. The flexible 18-month program is taught by international faculty, has a diverse student body with 16 years of average work experience, includes opportunities to network via newly-introduced global immersion weeks in Singapore and Dubai, and results in an Australian degree.

370.title: My heart is broken: Nick Carter on brother Aaron Carter's death
370.article_body: After Aaron Carter passed away, Backstreet Boys singer Nick Carter penned an emotional post and shared some throwback pictures on Instagram. "My heart is broken," he wrote and cited "addiction and mental illness" as the "real villain" behind Aaron's death. "Now you can finally have the peace you could never find here...I love you baby brother," he concluded.

371.title: Being told to clean up pet dog's mess, Mumbai siblings assault neighbour
371.article_body: The Mumbai Police booked three siblings for allegedly assaulting their neighbour and her mother when they were told to clean up their pet dog's mess. The victim said that the dog defecated in front of their door and the accused didn't bother to pick it. When asked to put on a leash, the accused and her siblings assaulted the victims.

372.title: Man assaults, tries to rob mobile of app service auto driver in Pune
372.article_body: An auto driver, attached to a mobility service app company, was assaulted in Pune while he was on his way to drop off a passenger in Yerawada's Shastri Nagar Chowk on Wednesday. The accused tried to rob his mobile and when the victim resisted, he was threatened and thrashed. The victim has sustained injuries on the face, head and back.

373.title: Gigi Hadid quits Twitter after Elon Musk's takeover, shares post of fired employee
373.article_body: Model Gigi Hadid has quit Twitter amid mass layoffs after Elon Musk took over the company. "For a long time, but especially with its new leadership, it's becoming more and more of a cesspool of hate & bigotry," she wrote. She also shared a post of Human Rights Counsel Shannon Raj Singh's tweet about being laid off from Twitter.

374.title: World's largest uncut emerald unearthed in Zambia, people say it looks like 'Kryptonite'
374.article_body: The world's largest uncut emerald, unearthed in Zambia, weighs 7,525 carats (1.505 kg), according to Guinness World Records. The emerald, discovered by geologists Manas Banerjee, Richard Kapeta and their team in July 2021, was named Chipembele, meaning "rhino" in the local indigenous dialect of the Bemba people of Zambia. Social media users commented the emerald looked like fictional 'Kryptonite'.

375.title: Not everything needs to have bird in the name: Musk to Dorsey on Twitter feature's name
375.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk and its Co-founder Jack Dorsey got into an argument on Monday over Musk changing the name of Twitter's 'Birdwatch' feature to 'Community Notes'. "I still think...Birdwatch is a far better name...Community Notes is the most boring Facebook name ever," Dorsey tweeted. Musk responded to him saying, "Not everything needs to have 'bird' in the name."

376.title: Without Suryakumar's 61*, India wouldn't have reached 150 vs Zimbabwe: Gavaskar
376.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said India batter Suryakumar Yadav is turning out to be the player who is taking India to totals that they can defend. "Without [Suryakumar's] 61 not out, India would not have reached even 150 [against Zimbabwe]," added Gavaskar. India defeated Zimbabwe by 71 runs in their T20 World Cup match on Sunday.

377.title: Twitter employee quit his job so that his co-workers could 'keep their jobs'
377.article_body: A Twitter employee revealed that he resigned from his role at the company so that his co-workers "might get an opportunity to keep their jobs". Andrew Haigh tweeted, "This wasn't an easy decision but it was the right one at the right time. I left on my own terms." Haigh joined Twitter in 2016 and was based out of London.

378.title: Ex-assistant professor, addicted to betting, arrested for robbery in B'luru
378.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a former assistant professor for allegedly breaking into a house in Bengaluru and robbing a gold chain from a senior citizen. The accused revealed that he had suffered huge losses in cricket betting two years ago. He was dismissed from the college in which he worked for siphoning off ₹4 lakh, the police added.

379.title: 4 domestic helps rob businessman of crores in Raj, escape in his car
379.article_body: Four domestic helps robbed their employer’s house after serving them food laced with sedatives in Rajasthan’s Jodhpur on Saturday, officials said. The accused, including a woman, were hired without police verification. They decamped with cash and jewellery worth crores from handicraft businessman Ashok Chopra’s house, officials added. They also took his car while escaping.

380.title: Gal Gadot congratulates Alia Bhatt-Ranbir Kapoor on becoming parents
380.article_body: Hollywood actress Gal Gadot congratulated Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor as they welcomed a baby girl on Sunday. "Congratulations," she wrote in the comment section of Alia's Instagram post. Gal will be seen as the lead actress of Alia's Hollywood debut film 'Heart of Stone', which also stars Jamie Dornan. The Tom Harper directorial will release on OTT in 2023.

381.title: Video shows Mumbai man selling Rail Neer for ₹20 instead of ₹15, probe on
381.article_body: A Mumbai vendor sold 'Rail Neer' for ₹20 instead of ₹15 at Lokmanya Tilak Terminus. A video of the incident was shared by the Free Press Journal. After the video went viral, a senior Central Railway official said that an inquiry has been initiated. "If anyone is found guilty, appropriate action will be taken against the culprit," the official added.

382.title: There is no doubt that Rohit Sharma is not batting well: Harbhajan
382.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said there is no doubt that Rohit Sharma is "not batting well", having scored 89 runs in the five matches played so far by India in T20 World Cup 2022. "One can only hope that Rohit...[performs] in the last two matches," added Harbhajan. "Suryakumar Yadav is shining...and that's a positive sign for India," he stated.

383.title: Comedian's Twitter account suspended after she impersonates Elon Musk; Tesla CEO reacts
383.article_body: Twitter suspended comedian Kathy Griffin’s account after she changed her display name to 'Elon Musk'. Reacting to this, Musk tweeted that her account was suspended for mimicking a comedian and that she can “get her account back for $8”. Earlier, Musk tweeted, "Going forward...Twitter handles engaging in impersonation without clearly specifying "parody" will be permanently suspended."

384.title: Stubble burning up by 160% in Rajasthan, 20% in Punjab in Oct: Jitendra Singh
384.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh expressed serious concern over Delhi's deteriorating air quality and said that stubble burning cases have witnessed a rise of 160% in Rajasthan and 20% in Punjab this October as compared to October 2021. "The governments in the two states are not doing enough to check stubble burning," said Singh.

385.title: Iron bars pierce bus as it hits truck carrying them in UP; 2 dead
385.article_body: Two people were killed and 12 others injured after a private sleeper bus rammed into a truck carrying iron bars on Sunday on Yamuna Expressway when the latter reportedly slowed down at the cut for Sadabad in Uttar Pradesh. During the incident, the iron bars in the truck pierced the bus. The injured passengers were taken to a hospital.

386.title: Video shows PM Modi blessing couples at 'Papa Ni Pari' mass wedding event in Gujarat
386.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday attended a mass wedding event 'Papa Ni Pari Lagnotsav' in Gujarat's Bhavnagar. A video of the event shows PM Modi blessing several couples as they touch his feet at the end of the event. More than 550 women who have lost their fathers got married at the event.

387.title: Started hitting the ball & never stopped: Suryakumar on 61* vs Zimbabwe
387.article_body: Discussing his 61* off 25 balls in Team India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Zimbabwe, Suryakumar Yadav said, "[I] started hitting the ball and never stopped." "My plan is always clear," added Suryakumar. "You can scarcely believe that...finish. Keep the highlights...Watch them again and again," read a tweet from commentator Harsha Bhogle, expressing his admiration for Suryakumar's 61*.

388.title: Price of apples falls after huge arrivals in market in Hyd: Report
388.article_body: Price of apples has dropped sharply compared to the last three years following a massive arrival of the fruit in the market in Hyderabad, The Siasat Daily reported. "A dozen good quality apples cost between ₹180 and ₹200," a fruit trader said. This is due to "bumper crop in both Kashmir and Himachal Pradesh", the secretary of Batasingaram market said.

389.title: 19-yr-old kills self in UP over death of stray dog she fed regularly
389.article_body: A 19-year-old girl jumped to death from a water tank in UP's Meerut after one of the street dogs she fed regularly was injured in an accident and died. Seeing the dog hit by a vehicle, the girl brought it home and consulted a veterinary doctor. However, the dog was in severe pain and died in front of her.

390.title: Delhi govt to decide on ease in restrictions, reopening schools in meeting today
390.article_body: In a key meeting that will be held in the national capital today, the state government will decide on easing the restrictions imposed on BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel vehicles and reopening primary schools. Reports quoted an official as saying that discussion will also be held around whether to continue with 50% work [from home] of government employees or not.

391.title: Chennai-Mysore Vande Bharat Express trial run begins, pics surface
391.article_body: The Chennai-Mysore Vande Bharat Express trial run started from Chennai's MG Ramachandran Central Railway Station on Monday morning. This is the first Vande Bharat service in south India, and the fifth one across India. The average speed of the train will be between 75-77 km per hour, covering the 504-km distance in around six and a half hours.

392.title: Meta to lay off 'thousands' of employees this week: Report
392.article_body: Meta is planning to begin large-scale layoffs this week which could affect many thousands of employees, The Wall Street Journal has reported. This could be the largest round of job cuts at a major technology company to date. It would also be the first broad headcount reductions to occur in Meta's 18-year history. Meta employed 87,000 people as of September.

393.title: 1 kid dies of malnutrition, 2 of unknown reasons in Mumbai family in 48 hrs
393.article_body: Three children of the same family died within a span of 48 hours in Mumbai's Govandi. While the doctors said that one of them died due to severe protein malnutrition, the cause of death of other two children are not known yet. Municipal Corporation Executive Health Officer said that this is a matter of concern and will be investigated.

394.title: 'Adipurush' to now release on June 16 next year, confirms director
394.article_body: Director Om Raut shared that 'Adipurush' will now release on June 16, 2023. He said that to give a complete visual experience to the audience, the makers needed more time to work on the film. "We are committed to make a film that India will be proud of," Raut added. 'Adipurush' was earlier scheduled for January 12, 2023 release.

395.title: Twitter asks some fired employees to return as they got 'laid off by mistake': Reports
395.article_body: After firing 50% of its employees following Elon Musk’s takeover, Twitter is now asking some laid-off employees to return as some of those were fired by mistake, as per reports. A report also stated that some employees were let go before the management realised that their work may be necessary to build the new features Musk envisions.

396.title: Edtech startup Brainly fires nearly all team members from its India team
396.article_body: Poland-based edtech startup Brainly has laid off nearly all team members from its India team. "Unfortunately, we were not able to maintain some of the roles focused on developing our paid plans and products," a company spokesperson said. Brainly employed nearly 35 people, mostly women, in India. It has offered departure packages to all 25 employees affected by the move.

397.title: Twitter to suspend accounts impersonating others if not labelled 'parody': Elon Musk
397.article_body: Elon Musk has issued a warning on impersonation on Twitter, saying, "Any Twitter handles engaging in impersonation without clearly specifying 'parody' will be permanently suspended." "Previously, we issued a warning before suspension, but now that we are rolling out widespread verification, there will be no warning," he added. This comes after several accounts on Twitter impersonated him.

398.title: Production cut in China to hit iPhone 14 Pro & Pro Max shipments: Apple
398.article_body: Apple has said that a production cut at its Zhengzhou plant in China amid COVID-19 curbs will lead to lower shipments of iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max models than previously anticipated. "The facility is currently operating at significantly reduced capacity," Apple said. Earlier, employees could be seen fleeing the plant amid curbs.

399.title: Twitter asking some fired employees to return after massive layoffs: Reports
399.article_body: After massive layoffs at Twitter that affected workers and teams across the world as Elon Musk took over the social media company, some fired employees are being asked to rejoin, multiple reports have said. At least five people who are "essential for Twitter's ecosystem" have been asked to return, said Business Insider. One person has rejected the offer, it said.

400.title: Won't allow trials of genetically modified mustard: Rakesh Tikait
400.article_body: Bhartiya Kisan Union leader Rakesh Tikait said he won't allow the trials of genetically modified (GM) mustard proposed by the Centre. "When something is banned in the whole world...then what is the need for the Indian government to allow the cultivation of GM mustard," he asked. Tikait announced a demonstration in Lucknow on November 26 against the government's "anti-farmer policies".

401.title: Centre not serious about J&K polls or statehood: Congress leader
401.article_body: Congress leader Vikar Rasool Wani claimed that the BJP-led Centre is not serious about holding Assembly elections in J&K or restoring its statehood. "The Centre is...only hoodwinking people by issuing vague statements from time to time for the last three and half years," said Wani. He also sought support for the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' to defeat the "politics of hate".
